Lorfords is a traditional specialist tobacconist, in the old-fashioned style, which has been trading at or near its present location in Bury St Edmunds for around a hundred years. As well as a baffling range of pipe and hand-rolling tobaccos, snuffs and cigarettes the shop features a walk-in humidor where numerous Cuban and other hand-made cigars can be found. Smokers requisites are also  available, from beautiful briar wood pipes to whatever filter or tool your particular tobacco habit might call for; some of these items, for example cigarette lighters, can make for great gifts. Be warned that Lorfords also operates as a regular corner newsagent and confectioner (including traditional jarred sweets) so can be very busy, particularly on Saturdays when everyone comes in for their Lottery tickets!

Above the tobacconist on a mezzanine level you will find Lorfords Games Gallery, which stocks traditional and unusual games. The range here is aimed at adults rather than children and includes chess, backgammon and mahjjong sets, board games, poker chips, playing cards and many other games and gaming equipment. This is a great place for present ideas.

Title: LP Bar
Body:
The LP is a bar, restaurant, live music venue & nightclub. The restaurant has a woodstone oven and the menu includes pizzas, pastas, burgers & salads. There is a Sunday roast too. Eat in or take-away.

The bar serves coffees, juices, over 20 old & new world wines, real ale & a large selection of spirits.  Beers and cocktails are served too.
The first floor club is open until 3.00am. Resident & guest DJ's feed the dance floor with a Martin Audio system.

Children are welcome on the ground-floor until 10.00pm go to our website or download "The LP Bar" app for more information & a live music events calendar.

Title: LPR Express
Body: An Eastern European Grocery store.

Title: Maison Bleue
Body:
Experience modern French fine dining featuring the finest local seasonal delicacies, lovingly crafted into artistic dishes by owner- chef Pascal Canevet and his team. Award winning Maison Bleue offers an understated elegance with a relaxed and welcoming ambiance. Many of the period features have been retained including oak beams and an original fireplace. In contrast the private dining room has an intimate feel with deep luxurious tones and modern features.

Owner-chef Pascal serves a spectacle of seasonal dishes, meat, fish, vegetarian and superb puddings, including updated renditions of French classics as his signature dish. You can expect a top-notch Lunch, Dinner and A La Carte menu. Maison Bleue serves a gastronomic delight ? it?s a foodie?s heaven.
 
Tables are swayed in crisp white linen with the front of house team in neat waistcoats and the sommelier on hand to offer advice, should you wish, from their extensive wine list. The wine cellar boats over 300 vintages, personally selected to compliment the superb modern French cuisine. The restaurant seats 65 with a private dining room for parties, celebrations and corporate dining.
 
Wining critical acclaim both locally and nationally Maison Bleue is a very special fine dining experience. Menu's change frequently with unique innovative twists to hi-light the seasonal flavours and events are run throughout the year to celebrate Pascal's passion for cooking and his unmistakable style.
 
Find out what?s on the menu on their website.
 
Join us for lunch and enjoy our seasonal 2 course lunch at �19.50 or 2 course Dinner at �35.00
 
Maison Bleue is celebrating its? success after being rated by TripAdvisor as one of the top restaurants in the UK in the annual Travellers? Choice Awards 2015 for the third year running.

Title: Market
Body:
Bury St Edmunds has an ancient market with an enviable range of fine local produce and non-food stalls ranging from jewellery to engineering equipment. It has done pretty well through the recession and a business plan is in place to try to ensure it does even better.

 
The market has a long and colourful history dating back to the days of William the Conqueror. Today, the market comprises 70 - 90 stalls selling a wide range of products which snake through the Cornhill and Buttermarket area of the attractive old town every Wednesday and Saturday.
 
There are hot food vendors including hog roast, burgers and cr�pes, and plenty of non-food businesses ranging from jewellery, cards and clothing to more unusual niche stalls such as motorcycle accessories and engineering equipment. On most market days the market is packed with locals, shoppers from across Suffolk and tourists who visit Bury for its history and architecture.

Title: Marks & Spencer
Body: One of the UK's leading retailers with around 21 million customers visiting their stores each week, Marks and Spencer sell high quality, great value clothing and home products as well as outstanding quality food, responsibly sourced from around 2,000 suppliers globally.

Title: Marshall Buck & Casson
Body:
An Independent Estate Agency
Marshall Buck & Casson is an independent estate agency based in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk. They are proud members of the OEA (the Ombudsman Estate Agency scheme) and The Guild of Professional Estate Agents. Trading as Marshall Buck & Casson, they sell a diverse range of both residential and commercial property. 

Based in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk
Established in 1992, the company has rapidly built an enviable reputation as one of the areas leading estate agents. Recommended by many local solicitors, their expert local knowledge and focus on customer service will ensure that selling or buying a property through them will go through as smoothly as possible.

Staff with professional skills
Moving means so much more than simply changing addresses, it usually represents a life style change or is in response to a larger or smaller family situation. They realise that whilst moving is exciting it can sometimes be stressful. Their approach is to make it as easy as possible. If you are selling they will work with you to make the process of finding a buyer as straight forward as possible. If you are looking for a home, they will listen to what you are looking for and do their best to match you with one of the many delightful homes they are instructed to sell.

Their staff are chosen not only for their professional skills but their way with people too. This means that you will always know that there is a friendly professional person with your best interests in mind.

Make Sure Your Agent of Choice:
Has an office in the town centre and is not working from home or an office without prominent window space
Advertises every week in the Bury Free Press as well as being on Rightmove - Premium Listing
Gives prompt and detailed feedback
Has a valuer contactable 7 days a week
Arranges Energy Performance Certificates
Produces floor plans on all details
Plus full particulars (not abbreviated) on internet
Free accompanied viewing available at most times

Title: May Alterations
Body: May Evans has 20 years experience in the clothing trade. Offering alterations and repairs to wedding and bridesmaid dresses, evening dresses, prom night outfits, men?s suits, jackets, leather coats, trousers, skirts, curtains and boat cushions.

Title: McDonalds
Body:
McDonald?s is the biggest family restaurant business in the world, serving approximately 3 million customers a day in the UK alone.
 
Our employees are committed to being the best they can be by always delivering a great customer experience.
 
McDonald?s has operated in the UK since 1974 with over 1,200 UK restaurants.

Title: Michael Birnie
Body:
Michael Birnie designs and makes award-winning contemporary jewellery in platinum, gold and silver at his studio and store at 9 Hatter Street.  Alongside his own Purely Platinum collection there are also other contemporary designer collections in silver, steel and aluminium.

Michael and his wife Linda set up their company in 1998.  After winning the prestigious UK Jewellery Designer of the Year award in 2003 Michael had gone on to be shortlisted twice in 2008 and 2012 for Best Bridal Collection in Platinum, the award was sponsored by the Platinum Guild International.  Michael individually makes each engagement and wedding ring at his studio.  Although specialising in platinum Michael's work is also available in 18ct gold and in palladium.  Bespoke commissions are also taken.  

Evening appointments are offered for those clients who are unable to visit the store during normal hours or who simply prefer this option.

A remodelling service is also offered whereby diamonds from a client's own jewellery can be set into a more contemporary piece.

Title: Micks Cycles
Body:
Micks Cycles is one of the best known and longest established bike shops proudly serving the community in Suffolk, with over 44 years of experience. With a recent expansion, we have a Bike Fit studio, NOW OFFERING 0% FINANCE, tax free schemes, and a modern workshop facility with qualified Cytech technicians catering for all repair and servicing requirements. Our main bike and accessory brand is Specialised with a large range of adult and kids bikes located over 2 floors, with an extensive range of clothing, shoes and helmets in store. Our other brands include, Whyte, Merida, Marin and Claud Butler.
 
Now open 7 days a week, there is plenty of time for us to find the ideal bike for you. Since establishing in 1970, where we started by selling motorcycles the business is still run by the same family, spanning 3 generations. It has grown into one of the top performance bike stores in the area.
 
A bike set up and body fit area is available where our highly trained and experienced staff can size you up for the perfect bike. Alongside our ever expanding range of bikes, we offer the latest and best known accessory shoe and clothing brands to compliment your bike purchase.
 
We have both male and female staff who are there to help with anything the customer may require, including specialised body geometry fit components, accessories, repairs, or even a new bike.
 
We pride ourselves on our customer service, our level of knowledge, and excellent after sales care. With our wide range of leading bike brands and styles that we trust and enjoy riding ourselves, we feel assured we can find the perfect bike for you, from kids bikes up to competition and outright racing bikes.
Location: 68-69 St John\'s Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Milpets
Body: Bury St Edmunds renowned pet shop, for pets and pet supplies.
Location: 5 St Johns Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Mings Oriental
Body:
Mings Oriental in the heart of Bury St Edmunds, is a huge hit with coffee lovers and hungry diners making their way in from dawn to dusk.
Proud of its independent nature, its fresh cooking ethos and exceptionally friendly service, Ming has designed the menu with his Chinese heritage in mind, to deliver traditional recipes with a modern twist.
Providing a relaxing inviting space available for intimate dining, large parties or private functions, the cafe is open late every day.

Title: Mistral
Body:
Mistral is a family owned company with a growing chain of women's clothing stores and dedicated stockists. They are also available online to give customers UK and Worldwide access to the Mistral womens fashion clothing label. In 2011 Mistral appointed its first independent reseller - Alexandras of Keswick and is now rapidly expanding its network of Mistral stockists throughout the UK.

All the garments they sell are in-house designed with a lot of love and attention. The team aims to bring you a great range of products which you can adapt to any occasion whether walking your dog, dropping the kids at school or going out to dinner. They offer everything in a fantastic range of colours trying hard to be affordably stylish without compromising on quality at the same time.

Title: MLB Dentysta LIMITED
Body: One of the tasks of MLB Dentysta is to provide health care services. It has one location in Suffolk County. The company subsidiary in Bury St Edmunds has operated since September 5, 2013, and provides dental services.
Location: 24 St Andrews Street North, Bury St Edmunds,

Title: Mobile Phone Experts
Body: Mobile Phone Experts is the one stop shop for everything you need for your mobile phone. The shop can help repair screens, charging problems and help to unlock your phone. As well as the repairing service, the business stocks mobile batteries, USB cables and chargers for various phone types.
Location: 46 Abbeygate Street, Bury St Edmunds, IP33 1LB

Title: Model Junction
Body:
Model Junction was founded by the present owners in 1978. Initially the shop catered primarily for the model railway enthusiast, which it still does, being one of the best stocked model shops in East Anglia.

Through the years the size of the shop and the range of items supplied has increased to include radio control, cars, boats and planes, Scalextric, Mamod and a vast array of plastic kits, in fact everything for the model maker. 
Model Junction still pride themselves on their personal service for both visitors to the shop and their mail order customers, who have come to appreciate their fast and efficient service.

Whatever your interests, a place not to be missed on a visit to Bury St Edmunds, at the centre of East Anglia.

Title: Monsoon
Body:
Monsoon clothing understands every woman?s need, which is why they only make the best of everything when it comes to clothing and accessories for women. 

Dresses at Monsoon are definitely one of the popular products on offer, with a full range of evening dresses offering a glamorous touch while their day dresses are really comfortable and fun. Monsoon?s Maxi dress collections are favoured by many shoppers as they are made to fit any size and shape whilst still looking fabulous. Monsoon clothing also has knitted dresses that would surely define your curves whenever you wear them.

Title: Mountain Warehouse
Body:
Mountain Warehouse offer the best value at the lowest prices for all your outdoor pursuits, whether you are an avid hiker looking for hiking boots, a cyclist after comfort and style or skiing enthusiast looking to hit the slopes. Their ever expanding range now includes skiwear, technical and waterproof clothing, hiking boots, snow boots, base layers; suitable for hiking, walking, camping, travel, skiing, cycling, equestrian and running to name a few.

Their skiwear range has ski clothing which is great for the first time skier right through to ski outfits for those who were born to ski. The brand lives up to its name and is parallel to none, offering warmth, comfort and durability while never compromising of style. Their range of ski jackets and ski pants are highly functional items of outdoor clothing that will keep you protected from the elements. With a huge range of hats, gloves, scarves, ski tubes and ski goggles Mountain Warehouse has the whole package at great prices.

Title: Moyse's Hall Museum
Body:
This beautiful medieval museum in the heart of Bury St Edmunds houses rich and eclectic collections and changing exhibitions, and hosts events ranging from themed craft workshops for all the family to historical talks and lectures.  Steeped in history, Moyse?s hall has looked out over Bury St Edmunds market place for almost 900 years.

The landmark 12th century building?s rich and varied past has included serving as the town?s Bridewell, workhouse and police station, first opening as a museum in 1899.
Today the museum offers a fascinating view into the past with collections that document the foundation of the early town ? from the creation and dissolution of the Abbey, to prison paraphernalia,  
St Edmundsbury?s world class collection of horology including rare timepieces bequeathed by musician and clock collector Frederic Greshom-Parkington; fine art by Sir Peter Lely, Angelica Kauffman, James Tissot, and England?s ?first? paintress Mary Beale, the Suffolk Regiment gallery, plus regularly changing exhibitions in the Great Hall.
Location: Cornhill, Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, IP33 1DX

Title: Moza
Body:
Moza is your number one Indian takeaway service.
 
To experience Moza takeaway please view the menu on their website here and place your order.
 
We deliver within a 7 mile radius on orders over �20, or you can save 10% on order over �20 when you collect from us on St Andrews Street North.
Location: 8-9 St Andrews Street North, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Mr Shoes
Body: Mr Shoes offers designer inspired affordable shoes for both men and women, with an huge range of high heels, flats, trainers, boots and sandals for the fashion forward. Setting trends Mr Shoes remains one of the best footwear retailers on the high street with the brands to prove it. Choose from Irregular choice, Fly London, TOMS shoes, Iron Fist, Bunker, Wrangler, Rocket Dog and Jeffery West, all of which can be found both in store and online at Mr Shoes.

Title: Muffin Break
Body: Muffin Break is a unique cafe bakery offering customers an irresistible combination of fresh baked products and quality espresso coffee. Their freshly baked muffins are traditionally baked each day are ?always fresh.? In addition to the muffins, Muffin Break also prepares a wide range of sweet and savoury products, including cakes, scones, cookies, yo yo?s, sandwiches, paninis, toasties, quiches and pies- and much, much more- all of which are freshly prepared and baked on the premises using the freshest of ingredients, with no additives or preservatives.  Teamed with the above is their exclusive espresso coffee.  This unique blend consists of 100% Arabica beans; sourced from six regions around the world, each selected for its unique properties, and prepared in store by their trained baristas, ensuring their customers receive the perfect cup every time.

Title: My Dentist
Body: My Dentist in Bury St Edmunds is a highly regarded dentist, which supplies dental care to the community, offering general dental care.

Title: Nandos
Body:
Home of the famous Peri-Peri sauce, Nandos welcomes all to enjoy its chicken focussed lunch and dinner menus. 
 
Find many delights at this family-friendly venue and don't forget to try its delicious line-up of desserts too.
 
Offering two floors of seating, enjoy panoramic venues of arc shopping centre whilst enjoying your meal. 
 
The restaurant offers a number of discounts including 20% off for the military, NHS staff, emergency service personnel and unlimited cineworld card holders between Monday and Friday.
 
The perfect place to visit with friends and family.
Location: Arc Centre, Prospect Row, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Nanook
Body:
If you are looking for a special outfit that you won't find anywhere else on the High Street, then Nanook is your shop.

All our collections are Made In Italy, home to the world's most famous fashion houses. You will love the tailoring and the creativity of our clothes.

With fabrics that fall elegantly, feel beautiful to touch and wear, all at surprisingly good prices, we guarantee you'll be back many times throughout the season! 

All our clothes have been hand picked, often exclusive to Nanook in the UK, and generally available in very small quantities.

Title: Nationwide Building Society
Body:
Nationwide has mutual (as opposed to Public Limited Company) status, which means that they are owned by and run for the benefit of their members.

They are one of the top three savings providers and mortgage lenders in the UK. More significantly, they are the largest building society in the world.

They approach to providing financial services is incredibly straight-forward. They aim to offer a broad range of great value mortgages, savings and other financial products, while charging as little as possible for day-to-day services.

They take pride in doing our best for their members and championing the rights of all consumers. They fought for honesty and transparency in the credit card market and were the first provider to publish a Summary Box on all their credit card information. The Summary Box highlights all fees and charges which most providers hide in their small print. All UK credit card providers publish Summary Boxes which enable consumers to compare cards from different providers, and allow them to make a more informed choice.

We've over 160 years of expertise and experience at being a building society, looking after the interests of our members. And they intend to deliver great value to their members as a modern, mutual building society for many years to come.

Title: Natwest
Body: In March 2000, The Royal Bank of Scotland Group completed the acquisition of NatWest in a �21 billion deal that was the largest take-over in British banking history. NatWest is now part of one of the world's largest financial services groups .With 3,600 branches, they have developed a wide range of services including loans and security services. In the International Banking Division, they provide international banking services to large companies.

Title: Neals Yard Remedies
Body: Offering organic skincare and natural healthcare, Neal's Yard Remedies is founded on the belief that health and beauty should be natural. With a strong dedication to protecting the planet, along with a passion for pushing against the chemical synthetic approach, Neal's Yard Remedies strives to discover and deliver natural ways to improve health and wellbeing. Its entire range makes use of the highest quality organic plant-based ingredients, as no other ingredient contains higher levels of beneficial antioxidants, minerals, essential amino acids and vitamins.

Title: Neptune
Body:
Our Bury St Edmunds showroom is a centre of excellence for design. It features a new pioneering design studio where you can work with our friendly team of expert in-house designers to tailor Neptune furniture to your own specifications, using a choice of different colour and fabric options.
 
Passion for fantastic design and exceptional customer service is at the core of our store, and our team of experts offer specialist advice on everything from the flooring right up to the ceiling.
 
Whether you are choosing a bespoke kitchen or a simple lamp; we have the full range of kitchens, furniture and accessories, paints, natural stone, timber flooring and quality work surfaces, so come and see us at the showroom, and let us help you, transform your home.
Location: Caxton House,  43-45 St. Andrews Street South, Bury St. Edmunds,

Title: NetExtra Ltd
Body: NetXtra is one of the UK's leading online digital communications companies. Specialising in web consultancy, design, development, integration and hosting services to primarily the membership, charity, not-for-profit and commercial sectors.
Location: Linden Square, 146 Kings Road, Bury St Edmunds

Title: New Look
Body:
New Look is one of the most well-recognised fashion brands in the UK. Their brand pillars of fashion excitement, value and newness are at the heart of everything they do. The brand delivers irresistible fashion at brilliant prices which means more fashion excitement for their customers - more of those 'Wow! Look what I've just found' moments. This means they can take on the competitors - with genuinely surprising prices and with fashion credentials that set them apart from other value retailers.  

New Look translates the latest trends from the catwalk, celebrities and the streets as fast as they can, providing their customers with fashion that is bang on trend - and great value to boot. They regularly win awards for their clothing and footwear and are today the number 2 womenswear and accessories retailer by value in the UK, with 5.8% market share. New Look isn't just for the girls either - they are gaining market share in menswear too.
Location: Arc Shopping Centre, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Next
Body:
Next is a UK based retailer offering exciting, beautifully designed, excellent quality fashion and accessories for men, women and children together with a full range of homewares. For over 25 years, Next has been one of Britain?s most popular brands ? acclaimed for its mastery of classic contemporary style evidenced in the combination of outstanding design, great quality and true value. 

Today, Next has beautiful things for you, your family, and your home. There are over 650 Next stores worldwide, and, as Europe?s biggest fashion e-tailer (with a global online presence through Next Direct), the brand is at the forefront of home-shopping too.

Title: NFU Mutual
Body: With a growing agency, the Bury St Edmunds branch controls premiums of over �6,000,000. The business is led by David Blackwell, Geoff Anthony, Lorna Santon and Alex Walters who have been working with NFU Mutual collectively for almost 30 years. They are supported by a dedicated team of insurance professionals who will know you as a name rather than a number and will guarantee to do their very best to assist you.
Location: Agriculture House, 93-95 Risbygate Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Nicola Sexton
Body:
Its sleek contemporary design and stylish interior sets out Nicola Sexton as a fabulous new footwear store making its mark on the retail scene of Bury St Edmunds' prestigious Abbeygate Street. Like most women, founder Nicola Sexton has always had a love for shoes and when work regularly took her to the South of France she discovered many unknown Italian brands. Pursuing her dream, Nicola was also intent on meeting personally with each individual designer and, as a result, is now able to offer a completely original collection. Nicola is honoured to be the only UK retail outlet offering a collection from her personal favourite designer, Luciano Padovan.

As well as the exclusive Padovan range you will find other wonderful Italian and Spanish brands providing a varied price and product choice. Nicola offers a stunning selection of Pavoni handbags made from the softest calf leather and is pleased to be the only authorised supplier in Bury St Edmunds. This, together with a large range of Italian jewellery by Barbara Easton and exquisite variety of Italian leather belts, gives her clients the unique opportunity to coordinate the accessories to complete their look.

Title: No.4 Hatter Street
Body:
No.4 Hatter Street is Abbeygate Cinema's Georgian style licensed restaurant. It is perfect for a coffee and a chat, afternoon tea with home-made cakes, a relaxing glass of wine or a sit down meal, available day and night. 

This beautiful caf�/restaurant has a wonderful function room upstairs available for hire and perfect for private parties, business meetings and other events. 
 
Passionate about film.

A beautifully modernised yet perfectly original 1920's cinema. Screening everything from timeless classics to the box office latest releases. 

The cinema is packed full of comfy reclining seats and sofas, not only that but you can enjoy a glass of wine, beer or soft drink from the bar whilst watching your film.

Title: Norwich & Peterborough
Body:
They?re not a bank, they?re a mutual society, owned by their customers for their customers. That means they have no shareholders, so they can put you first. They are safe and secure.

They have diversified into areas not usually associated with building societies such as banking, insurance and financial advice, so their income doesn?t just rely on mortgages.

They have a network of branches in East Anglia. They?re locally run from the main office in Peterborough, so they will always be in touch with the communities where we operate.

You can always call your local branch, and even speak to the branch manager. If you prefer to, call their Contact Centre. You won?t end up speaking to someone in another country ? just a helpful adviser based in Peterborough

Title: Nowton Park
Body:
With almost 200 acres of landscaped Suffolk countryside there is something for everyone at Nowton Park.  

Nature lovers can visit the unique arboretum which is home to trees from around the world such as eucalyptus from Australia, paperbark maple from China and Kentucky coffee trees from North America. 
A panda was carved in 1998 and placed in the China region along with some bamboo to add to the vision of this geographical area.  
The Nowton Park totem pole stands 35.4 feet (10.8m) tall near the centre of the North American region of the arboretum. It is carved from a western red cedar which is the species traditionally favoured by Native Americans for their totem poles.

To your left when looking towards the main house from the lime avenue, you will see the bird feeding station on the edge of the wood. In the winter a variety of woodland birds can be seen such as the blue, great and long tailed tit, nuthatch and the great spotted woodpecker

The lime avenue is one of the finest examples in the UK and was planted around 1880 to give the estate a sense of grandeur. In spring over 100,000 daffodils bloom beneath the trees. 

Nowton Park also has a fantastic maze in the shape of a stylised oak tree (in commemoration of the Oakes family who were the former estate owners). The maze is open from May to October every year and is south of the park, 2km from the main car park. There are 2,500 hornbeam trees that make up over two miles of hedging, maintained at a height of around two metres. The centre of the maze is marked by a fastigiate oak (with upright branches).
There are two ponds in Nowton Park - the meadow pond which is rich in aquatic life and is a draw for grass snakes as a place to bask, hunt and swim, and the school pond which is home to moorhens, mallards and the occasional grey heron which feeds on the introduced mirror and crucian carp.

The introduction of the wildflower meadow in 1990 with wildflowers, like birdsfoot trefoil has boosted the numbers of butterflies recorded in the park.
The park is also home to a large play area, football pitches, a picnic area and visitor centre.
Location: Bury Road, Nowton, Bury St Edmunds�IP29 5LU

Title: O2
Body:
O2 is the UK's leading provider of mobile phones and broadband, offering the best mobile phone, sim only, and broadband deals. Save money by buying direct! They?ve been around since 2002, and they?ve been busy. 

You might already use their mobile network or their broadband or you might have seen Take That at the O2, England at Twickenham or Tinie Tempah at an O2 Academy. Whatever you?ve seen, however you use O2, they?d like to hear from you.

Title: Oakes Barn
Body:
Find a range of six real ales, excellent wines and largers which have been selected to bring variety and excellence to complement one another. 
 
A community spirited free house that embraces itself with the historical links of the medieval town, enjoy the simplicity of a welcoming environment, the wholesome food on offer and the great value for money. 
 
Offering an exciting calendar of events, there's always plenty to do.
Location: St Andrew\'s Street South, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Odyssey
Body:
All year round, online and instore, at Odyssey you'll find an awesome selection of streetwear from some of the best labels in the industry. Constantly on the lookout for new up and coming brands, Odyssey is open to all new and exciting brand labels, so if you think there is a great company out there who would suit the store please get in touch!
Odyssey is very proud of its reputation as a core independent retailer and always carries a selection of surfboards, wetsuits and accessories (although you won't always find these online). If there is a specific type of board you are after, or just want some advice as to what sort of board to buy, please get in touch. Able to order gear in from several of the best board manufacturers in the business and always pleased to pass on a stoke for all things surf on to their customers, Odyssey is the place to shop!
Location: 14-15 St John\'s Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Old Cannon Brewery
Body: A genuinely independent free house in Bury St Edmunds and the only brew pub in Suffolk where you can actually see beer in the making on a regular basis. The beers are made on the premises using East Anglian grown and malted barley and choice hops. Runners-up in the Suffolk Food &  Drink Awards for Best Food Pub, our Brewery Kitchen serves fresh and seasonal produce purchased from known local producers – our style is British traditional/regional with a twist. The Brewery Rooms offer our bed and breakfast guests comfort and style in a warm, friendly and relaxed environment rounded off with a delicious Suffolk breakfast.
Location: The Old Cannon Brewery, 86 Cannon Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Olivia Benn
Body: Olivia Benn specialises in offering a personalised service to all it's customers with the emphasis on high quality beautifully styled garments and accessories for the discerning woman. They stock over forty different clothing collections from occasion wear to casual and day to evening. They pride themselves on their attention to detail with service from experienced sales and alteration staff whose main aim is to provide perfect outfits that look and feel wonderful, whatever the occasion.

Title: Orissa
Body: Style and fresh taste make a restaurant and the Orissa Contemporary Indian provides both in spades.

Title: Oxfam
Body:
Oxfam. What springs to mind? Charity shops and second-hand clothes? Africa? Think bigger. Much bigger. Last year, Oxfam emergency and development work reached a staggering 13.5 million people! 
 
From life-saving emergency responses to life-changing development projects, our amazing campaigning supporters help make all this possible.
 
In the Bury St Edmunds store, get your hands on clothing, homeware and interiors and accessories.

Title: Oxfam Books & Music
Body:
Oxfam. What springs to mind? Charity shops and second-hand clothes? Africa? Think bigger. Much bigger. Last year, Oxfam emergency and development work reached a staggering 13.5 million people! 
 
From life-saving emergency responses to life-changing development projects, our amazing campaigning supporters help make all this possible.
 
In the Bury St Edmunds store, get your hands on clothing, homeware and interiors and accessories.

Title: Paddy & Scotts
Body:
Starting with a genuine love of great tasting coffee between two friends, Paddy & Scotts has opened its second store in the heart of Bury St Edmunds. 
 
Bringing artisan coffee to our town, the dynamic team brings with it slow roasted coffee at its best. Committed to taste, sustainability and the environment, the team is the first to introduce aluminium free packaging, a coffee grout recycling program.
 
Pop in and try a new taste.

Title: Palmers
Body:
Whether you're searching for an outfit for a special occasion or something new for everyday wear, Palmers Bury St. Edmunds Fashion Store would be the perfect place to start. As well as a fine selection of ladies fashions and accessories, you'll find shoes, lingerie, cosmetics and fragrances - everything you might need for a complete make-over!
 
Ladies Fashion
Palmers ladies fashion department hosts a fantastic choice of modern and classic fashion designs to suit all ages. With everything from casual to formal wear from a number of top brands, you?re sure to find what you need at Palmers. All staff receive extensive inductions and on-going training in their area of expertise so if you need any assistance or advice our friendly sales advisors are always happy to help.
 
Lingerie
In the lingerie department find the widest possible choice from comfortable, practical underwear for everyday use to something chic and stylish for those special occasions. The fully trained lingerie experts offer a friendly fitting service, including mastectomy, maternity bras and larger cup sizes to suit your needs.
 
Fashion Accessories & Luggage
Palmers provide a wide range of stylish accessories for you to choose from including hats, handbags, belts, gloves, scarves and jewellery. You can also browse through its luggage department to find sturdy suitcases on wheels for that exotic holiday; carry bags with leather grips for your weekend breaks; smart briefcases for the office and padded bags to protect laptops or tablet computers.
 
Shoes
Take the weight off your feet while you choose your shoes. The shoe department offers a fine selection of footwear for women, with everything from the latest styles to classic designs. You won't be rushed into making this important purchase and you'll have all the help you need to ensure you get the perfect fit.
 
Cosmetics
Palmers is well known for its excellent range of top-brand skin care and cosmetics. The well-trained staff are delighted to offer consultations on makeup, skincare and foundation tailoring and they are always pleased to help you find a fragrance to match your style and personality.

Title: Palmers Homestore
Body:
Palmers Homestore in St Andrews Street, Bury St Edmunds features a wide range of excellent tableware and glass and offers a wonderful choice of linen, curtains and gifts for all ages.
 
China, Glass & Gifts
Whether you're looking for homewares for yourself or a memorable gift for a friend, the wealth of choice we offer makes browsing at Palmers a delight! Visit and find tableware for every occasion from al fresco eating to formal entertaining. The store also has a full range of crystal, cut and plain, vases, stemware and giftware.
 
Cookshop
If you're looking to make life in the kitchen just that little bit easier, try the Palmers cookshop. As well as a whole range of traditional high quality pots, pans and other paraphernalia, the store offers lots of utensils and gadgets, all designed to aid your culinary creativity.
 
Linens & Curtains
 
Cafe
Palmers Coffee Room boasts quality food and drink, including freshly squeezed fruit juices, speciality coffees and teas and a large selection of smoothies. As far as possible, the food is home-made. The scones and cakes have been customers' firm favourites for many years. Other home-made ranges include - sausage rolls, quiche, soup, hot meals, paninis, snacks and sandwiches.
Location: 61 - 63 St Andrews Street South, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Pandora
Body: PANDORA designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished and modern jewellery made from genuine metals at affordable prices. PANDORA jewellery is sold in more than 90 countries on six continents through approximately 9,600 points of sale, including more than 1,400 concept stores.
Location: Unit 19, arc Shopping Centre, Bury St Edmunds, IP33 3FD

Title: Papakis Deli
Body:
Papaki's Deli offers a wide selection of artisan Greek products, fine foods, sweet treats and a selection of beverages. The restaurant and cafe is run by the owners of Cafe Kottani.
 
The menu includes everything from Greek Phyllo Pies, Meze Plates and Greek Salad to tasty desserts including Baklava, Almond Cookies and Kantaifi.
 
The Deli has seating inside or your can take the taste of Greece home with you!
 
If you enjoy cooking, why not try the authentic Greek ingredients at home and sample your own dish?
 
Wi-fi is available in store.

Title: Paperchase
Body:
Paperchase is the UK?s undisputed leader in innovative, design-led stationery, cards and gift-wrap. They have been around for over 40 years and are now firmly established as the top destination for customers looking for new and different gifts, cards and stationery.

Much of their merchandise is exclusive. They love to innovate so their collections are constantly changing yet all are specified to their high quality requirements. Visit their stores and online and each month you will find new arrivals ? so for birthdays, Christmas and Valentine?s Day... indeed, for any occasion or celebration, there will always be new and different ideas to be found.

Title: Patisserie Valerie
Body:
At Patisserie Valerie they offer eat in or take away menu. In their menu they offer a wide range of quality products such as Egg Benedicts, Sandwiches and a range of salads and also have a wide range of fantastic cakes and pastries made by their own bakery and serve illy coffee. They also have a wide selection of other beverages and food. 

Come on in and enjoy the Patisserie Valerie experience.

Title: Pea Porridge
Body:
Pea Porridge is an independently owned neighbourhood restaurant located on a square which was once a green, called ?Pea Porridge Green? 

The restaurant is tucked away in a quiet residential area on Cannon Street. The building was originally two cottages built in 1820 which later became a bakery. The restaurant now comprises three delightful unpretentious dinning rooms with old pine tables, an open fire and a splendid bakers oven. 

The new owners Justin and Jurga Sharp share a passion for food and wine. They source top quality ingredients and with a Mediterranean feel to their food, simplicity has become genius in the kitchen. 

Why not treat yourself to NORFOLK LOBSTER? ....hurry it's on the menu only in summer, book a table & reserve it, because they do sell out!

...?A real find?; with its ?interesting and reasonably-priced food? and a good dose of ?rustic charm? too, this ?quirky backstreet restaurant? has been a ?most welcome? arrival; it serves a hearty British menu ?with lots of interesting ?nose-to-tail? dishes?...HARDEN'S GUIDE 2012...

"Charming restaurant in cosy 19C brick cottage - a former bakery - well run by husband and wife team. Tasty, seasonal, country-style cooking with a strong Mediterranean bias. Great value lunch menus. Biodynamic and organic old world wines. Efficient service."...THE MICHELIN GUIDE 2012

Title: Peacocks
Body:
Great value womens fashion, menswear and childrens clothing.
 
With an even greater range of fashionable men?s, women?s and children?s clothing at real value for money prices.
Location: Unit 30/31, The Arc, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Pearson Driving Assessments
Body: In 2003, Pearson VUE was awarded the world?s largest computer-based testing contract for the Driving Standards Agency (DSA) of Great Britain and the Driver and Vehicle Agency (DVA) of Northern Ireland.
Location: St Edmunds House, Lower Baxter Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Peel & Gudgin Opticians
Body: Established in 1936, Peel & Gudgin opened the very first branch in Bury St Edmunds. Moving to Angel Hill in 1939, the company grew to have an incredible reputation for a personal level of service unrivalled by high street chains. Providing various eye tests and selling a wide range of budget and designer frames, all the dispensing opticians are fully qualified and can offer you the highest level of service and care.

Title: Petrus Wine Bar
Body:
Down a small side street in Bury St Edmunds is Petrus Wine Bar. A place to meet people and socialise. We are a hub where you can come and simply enjoy everything that comes with a beautiful full tasting glass of wine.
 
Live Music
Every second Friday, the bar hosts a live music evening from different Artists. 
 
Wine List
We select only the finest wines for you. Our Wine List is adjusted frequently with selected wines sold by the glass. We are now serving Redwell Brewery Steam Lager on Tap.
 
Intimate Menu
Our Steaks are cooked using the sous vide (pronounced "soo-veed") technique, which involves cooking food in vacuum-sealed pouches submerged in a water bath held at a precisely-controlled temperature. Then finishing on a grill to your liking. This method cooks steak with incomparable taste and texture, perfectly cooked edge-to-edge.
 
Events
Petrus Wine Bar is the perfect place to host your birthday party or special occasion. We can provide a steak buffet, fizz and anything to make the occasion special.

Title: Phase Eight
Body:
Phase Eight is a leading women?s fashion retailer trading internationally. Phase Eight was established in 1979 by Patsy Seddon when she opened its first store in Wandsworth Common, London in order to design and sell clothes that satisfied a sophisticated taste but were affordable and practical. Her initial success has continued to this day.

To date Phase Eight has in excess of 80 stores and more than 90 concessions within department stores, including House of Fraser, Debenhams, Fenwick and the John Lewis Partnership, as well as a number of independent department stores.

Title: Pick Everard
Body:
Established in the 1860s, their head office is in Leicester with regional offices in, Bury St Edmunds, Derby, Glasgow, Inverness, London,Nottingham and Taunton.

With a 340-strong workforce, Pick Everard provides a comprehensive range of engineering, architectural and construction management services, from concept and feasibility studies through all stages of design, to site supervision, project management, cost control & commissioning. Single or multi-disciplinary teams are assigned to meet client and project requirements. Pick Everard has a project history in health, education, industry, defence, central and local government, leisure, private development, retail and financial services.

It draws upon a vast bank of skills from among its expert staff including architecture, water engineering and public health engineering, structural engineering, sustainability & environmental consultancy, building and land surveying, building services, electrical and mechanical engineering, building facilities, auditing and quantity surveying.

Pick Everard is a Government Procurement Service supplier to the Project Management & Full Design Team Services framework agreement.
Location: Weaver House, 9 Looms Lane, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Pigeon Investment
Body:
Pigeon is an entrepreneurial property company operating in the East of England to create value for shareholders and investors from the promotion of strategic land, commercial investment and other property related opportunities.

The management team have extensive knowledge of the regional market and demonstrate a powerful combination of corporate management and property skills.

Pigeon manages commercial and residential property investments of over �50m on behalf of its investors and is currently promoting land for over 7000 dwellings for its landowning partners.

Title: Pilgrims Kitchen
Body:
Introducing Pilgrims? Kitchen, the new restaurant at St Edmundsbury Cathedral. Accessed via the elegant Cloisters at the magnificent Cathedral in the heart of Bury St Edmunds, Pilgrims? Kitchen offers all visitors a warm welcome and a great new place to eat and meet.
 
The former Refectory has been transformed over the winter months into an inviting eating space with rustic furniture, quirky chapel chairs, pots of fresh herbs and heritage colours. Comfy sofas offer a more relaxed area for a cup of coffee, or the chance to catch up friends ? young friends are catered for too, with highchairs and toys. Wifi is now available. We are delighted to be offering Suffolk-based Paddy and Scott?s coffee as well as Fairtrade tea, James White Apple juice and a choice of Fairtrade wine or the iconic Greene King St Edmund?s ale.
 
Home cooked, locally sourced fayre, the signature food of chef, Paul Hughes, still tops the menu, so if warming stews, sausage and mash and fish on Fridays are your favourites, you need look no further.  You?ll probably get tempted by Apple Crumble or warm Chocolate Brownie for pudding too. Order at the counter, and the staff will bring your freshly prepared meal to you.
 
Locally sourced ingredients  - sauces from Stokes of Woodbridge, jams and chutneys from Elveden Estates and bread from Gastono-me ? are key to the choice of food on offer.
 
Cakes baked on the premises as well as the famous cheese scones will be back on the menu. Get there early for the scones as these are a favourite of the Cathedral staff! 
 
If you?re on the move, Pilgrims? Kitchen is offering an enhanced takeaway service ? whether it?s a quick coffee, a Danish pastry or your sandwich choice wrapped up in a neat box.
Location: Cathedral Office, Abbey House, Angel Hill, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Pizza Express
Body:
All restaurants claim to be passionate about service, but at PizzaExpress they really mean it. They only recruit 'people people' for their front-of-house teams and work hard to give their customers the warm welcome and attentive service they deserve.
Their aim is that every customer leaves PizzaExpress feeling that little bit happier and more relaxed than when they came in.

Title: Pizza Hut
Body:
In 1958, Frank and Dan Carney had an idea for a great local pizza restaurant in Wichita Kansas. The small 25 seat restaurant only had room for 9 letters on the sign? the building looked like a hut? so 'Pizza Hut' was born!
Fifteen years later, they opened the first UK restaurant and over 40 years and billions of pizzas later, they've become the biggest Pizza Company on the planet!

Title: Pledgers
Body: They are a family-run business established in 1953, selling ladies and mens footwear. They aim to give friendly, helpful assistance and advice within a relaxed atmosphere. Ladies will find a large collection of shoes in various width fittings from manufacturers such as Van Dal, Padders, Lotus, Rowde, Equity and Suave, Loake, Padders, Rowde and Lotus mens shoes are stocked. They also hold a range of slippers throughout the year, sandals and ladies boots are available seasonally as are drapers sheepskin slippers. They offer a good choice of bags, purses and wallets and they also have a variety of shoe care products, including polishes, laces and insoles.
Location: 84 - 85 St John\'s Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Pocket Watch & Petticoats
Body:
Pocket Watch and Petticoats sells glamorous 1940s and ?50s vintage attire for women. 
 
The shop, which stocks clothing in sizes 6 - 26 plus, is open seven days a week, from 9am-5pm Monday to Saturday and 10am-4pm on Sunday.
 
To find out more about the business, which sells everything from day dresses and full ?swirl? skirts to high-waisted trousers and ?wiggle? dresses, visit their Facebook page.
Location: 10 St John�s Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Poundland
Body:
Poundland work hard to bring you amazing value products everyday, over half of which are sourced from the UK. Sometimes the products they sell are just so popular that they may run out of stock, but they always try to replace them as soon as possible ? except perhaps, for some of their unrepeatable WOW offers!

From real deal top brands and daily essential items, to fantastic new lines and stunning WOW products, they hope their quality, variety and inflation busting style gives you irresistible value on each visit. Every week, millions of savvy customers enjoy the fun and exciting shopping experience of Poundland in hundreds of stores nationwide. They are very proud to offer you a single �1 price, that hasn?t changed since they opened their first store.

Title: Premier Travel
Body:
Premier Travel is a privately owned, independent travel agency with over 75 years' experience in the travel industry and 21 branches throughout East Anglia and southern England. 

Being independent, we have the flexibility to work with a multitude of tour operators to offer the widest range of travel products, from traditional UK holidays, bespoke tailor-made journeys around the world, cruises, city stays, beach holidays and theatre breaks to an overseas wedding of your dreams. Take a moment to explore the Holiday Types section of our website and discover for yourself the wide range of options available. 

We are extremely proud of our friendly, knowledgeable and highly experienced travel consultants. Renowned for their attention to detail they will always offer impartial advice and strive to provide the best service possible. 

For your peace of mind we are members of ABTA, so when you book with Premier Travel you benefit from ABTA?s assistance and Code of Conduct. Many of the travel arrangements that we sell are protected in case of financial failure of the travel company. Please ask us about the protection applicable to your booking. 

Find out why so many people regularly trust their travel arrangements to Premier Travel by visiting your local branch, calling or emailing us for a holiday quote or further information.

Title: Preston & Duckworth
Body:
Established since 1869, Preston and Duckworth are an independent family owned jewellers specialising in fine diamond jewellery and luxury brands. They have a wide selection of diamond rings and jewellery and the largest choice of wedding rings in Suffolk. They carry ranges including Bien, Charles Green & Sons and The Raphael Collection alongside Saint Maurice, Blumer and Breuning.

Their prestige watch range includes Breitling, Omega, Tag Heuer, Maurice, Lacroix, Raymond Weil, Tissot, TW Steel, Hugo Boss, Juicy Couture, Dreyfuss & Co and Rotary.

Alongside these they aim to offer a wide range of goods to suit all occasions. They carry silver jewellery from renowned brand names such as Pandora, Hot Diamonds and Tresor Paris, Carrs of Sheffield Silverware as well as Mont Blanc and Dunhill.

They pride theselves on customer service and their happy and friendly staff will do their upmost to ensure your shopping experience is a pleasurable one.
 
They also now have a first floor room where customers can take more time in a quiet and comfortable atmosphere to select an item of their choice
 
Further services available in-store include jewellery and watch repairs and bespoke jewellery design.

Title: Prezzo
Body:
The first Prezzo restaurant opened in Central London in 2000 and there are now more than 150 restaurants across the UK, from Aberdeen in Scotland to Falmouth in Cornwall.
The restaurants, which are all individually designed, have been built on the sites of a number of listed buildings or buildings of particular local interest.

Prezzo is renowned for offering a quality menu at value for money prices.

Title: Quest Gifts
Body:
Quest is nestled in the heart of the town on Abbeygate Street, offering the answer to all your gift shopping needs ? Christmas, Birthdays, Weddings, Baby ? every occasion is catered for. 
A stylish range of cards, gifts, homestyle accessories and jewellery ? all from leading supplier including Sia, Parlane, Gisela Graham and Cath Kidston toiletries.

Title: Raspberry Rascals
Body:
Since 2009, Raspberry Rascals has been all about good quality children?s products at a fraction of the price it costs to buy new and without the packaging and environmental baggage that this often brings. 

Buying and selling nearly new, good quality children?s clothes, shoes, toys, books and equipment, pre-loved or unused as well as a range of NEW toys, the team offer professional and friendly advice. 

For a stress-free shopping experience, there is a play area, a customer toilet, changing facilities and nursing area in store. Raspberry Rascals also support the Chernobyl Children?s Life Line charity by donating any unwanted items that are brought in to the shop. 

As of February 2015, the shop has been under the management of Pauline who along with Rachel and Maaike, looks forward to offering you a warm welcome to Raspberry Rascals.
Location: 7 Langton Place Off Hatter Street, Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, IP33 1NE

Title: Really Rather Good
Body:
The Really Rather Good coffee house enjoys a prime location overlooking Angel Hill?s town square. A small independent business, it aims to offer the very best coffee in town along with a wide range of top quality teas, complemented by home-made paninis, wraps, salads, daily specials and gorgeous cakes. 

So whether you?re looking for an Americano, a Rooibos, a Cappuccino, a Cortado, an Earl Grey, a bacon, brie and cranberry panini or perhaps an unusual cake you?ve never tried before, you?ll find them really rather good.

Title: RehabWorks
Body:
RehabWorks is a specialist business to business provider of work focused preventative, occupational health, case management and rehabilitation solutions to employers, insurers, solicitors and government.

Their aim is to educate, maintain, improve and restore wellness for work and life by offering health and wellbeing services such as Physiotherapy, Psychological Therapy, Occupational Health and Preventative programmes.
Location: Suffolk House, 7 Angel Hill, Bury St. Edmunds

Title: Revel Outdoors
Body:
Revel Outdoors is a professional and friendly cycling and tri shop. Their shop have an extensive range of cycles, accessories and clothing including triathlon kit. They cater for all types of cyclists, from children's bicycles, to traditional commuters and leisure hybrids, through to high-end road, triathlon and mountain bikes.
 
Their professional service centre is staffed with experienced Cytech trained mechanics for all servicing and repair work. They also offer custom bike and wheel building for something a little more bespoke.
 
Revel Outdoor's products are carefully selected, offering excellent value for money and items that are fit for purpose. They offer a bike fitting service to help ensure you get the most out of your riding. Between the staff members they use most of the products they sell and can help with advice and recommendations in all areas.

Title: Richard Green
Body:
Richard Green has been a long established estate agent in Bury. Previously they traded from offices on Angel Hill for over 20 years but they left the town in 2008. They have returned to their new offices in early 2014.
 
With a proven track record over many years in the marketing and subsequent sale of character and individual homes in the heart of East Anglia, Richard Green is synonymous with quality properties and a quality of service to match. As an independent family owned company it prides itself in its professional and personal approach whether your requirements involve the sale or purchase of a town house, small cottage, contemporary home or a substantial village rectory.
 
Originally established in 1988 and with key personnel benefiting from a 'Certificate in Historic Building Conservation' Richard Green swiftly became one of the area's leading Period Home specialists. With our depth of knowledge we ensure that both vendors and purchasers receive sound and reliable guidance making sure that your move will be as problem-free as possible.
 
Located in prestigious Grade II Listed offices in the historic core of the picturesque Cathedral town of Bury St Edmunds, Richard Green combine expert local knowledge, the latest technology and traditional values of integrity and commitment.

Title: River Island
Body:
With over 60 years of fashion retailing experience, River Island is one of the most successful companies on the High Street.  River Island is known for its stylish and affordable fashion and the unique touches it brings to its collections, which make them standout from the rest of the high street. Their customers love them for their great going-out looks, amazing denim and fabulous shoes and bags, as well as being the perfect place to pick up everything you could need to get a complete head-to-toe look. 

At River Island they try really hard to bring new and original fashion to you, with design at the heart of absolutely everything they do. Almost everything is designed in-house and with one of the largest design teams on the high street, this means they can have fabulous new fashion arriving in-store and online every single week.

Title: Romark Jewellers
Body:
You should only deal with competent and experienced jewellers and look and feel special when wearing your jewellery. At Romark, knowledgeable jewellers undergo extensive training regarding all jewellery. They will ensure you find exactly what you need and there are a wide variety of services offered.
 
They are a retail jewellers, specialising in antique and second-hand jewellery. They repair, alter, and restore broken or damaged jewellery and watches. They are also insurance valuers, goldsmiths with qualified knowledgeable and friendly staff. They also buy and sell second-hand jewellery.

Title: Royal Bank of Scotland
Body:
Having 40 million customers in over 50 countries shows they are committed to developing customer relationships that last. How do they do that? By understanding that everyone's different and they need different products at different times in their life.

Earning your trust
They see every day as a new chance to earn your trust. It demands hard work, integrity and transparency, but that's what they do. And they do it with the right people, the right attitude and commitment. Employing people in more than 50 countries and speaking over 30 languages helps them to achieve this.

Delivering on their promises
They still have a reputation for delivering what they say they'll deliver. This isn't always easy but they believe they have the skill, experience and stamina to do so. For example, every day they process 11 million transactions with a failure rate of 1 in every 6.2 million.

Moving forward together
With over 300 years of banking tradition behind them, they are moving forward by building on the fundamentals of banking - because that's what they do best. And they want to move forward with their customers.

So what does all this amount to? Quite simply, it means that every single one of their 40 million customers - you - can make better, more informed, financial decisions.

They want you to have peace of mind: in them; in the wider financial system; and in your own ability to create your secure financial future.

Title: Rudlings Wakelam
Body:
Rudlings Wakelam are an efficient and progressive firm of solicitors who have been providing their clients with legal advice and services since 1923.
They have a long-established and expert reputation in many areas of law including:
 
Wills & Probate | Family Matters | Property | Litigation | Commercial | Employment | Equestrian | Agriculture
 
With offices based in Bury St Edmunds, Brandon, Long Melford and Thetford they are available to give professional, realistic and clear legal advice in an efficient and sympathetic way. 
 
Rudlings Wakelam can also offer many Fixed Fees solutions where applicable. Their legal advice is explained and presented in a friendly, practical and personal manner, helping guide you through all aspects of law which may affect you throughout you life.

Title: Rush
Body:
Their unfaltering belief in providing the highest standard of hairdressing, alongside exceptional customer service has led to a flourishing hair and beauty group at the forefront of hairdressing.
 
Rush has expertly trained stylists, dedication to customer service, award winning salon interiors, latest services and treatments all represent their commitment to offering the ultimate, personal hairdressing experience.

Title: Ryman
Body:
As well as being the nation?s high street stationery specialist, many Ryman stores offer additional services to customers. For example, their services include:
?Photocopier machines ? including a bulk copying service in some stores
?Document binding & laminating
?Fax service
?Photo booth

All stores allow customers to order products for home delivery, which is particularly useful in the case of purchasing heavy items like chairs, desks, filing cabinets and the like. Just ask about this at any Ryman till. 

They have also recently introduced a DHL Service point at 70 stores, in order to offer customers a courier service allowing customers to send parcels securely around the world or within the UK. There are four Ryman stores that also have a Post Office.

Title: Saffron Launderers & Dry Cleaners
Body: Founded in 1897 and based in Saffron Walden, Saffron Launderers & Dry Cleaners is a family-run business that maintains an excellent reputation for customer care and dependable service.  Combining over 100 years of experience with the most up-to-date methods, Saffron Launderers & Dry Cleaners aims to provide top-quality laundry and dry cleaning services designed to meet every customer's individual needs. The company has gone from strength to strength over the years and now concentrates on the following areas: Dry cleaning, Personal Domestic Laundry, Commercial Laundry, Repairs and Alterations, Linen Rental, Occasional Table Linen Hire.

Title: Sahara
Body:
Sahara?s beautiful boutique is in the heart of the historic Bury St Edmund?s, it is a fashion haven for those seeking something different for every day wear to occasion wear.
Sahara?s collections appeal to an eclectic mix of devoted customers who are lured by their use of unusual natural fabrics sourced from across the globe in gorgeous designs created to flatter all shapes and sizes from 10-22.

Individual style is key to Sahara?s ethos, offering their customers an antidote to fast fashion.  The fusion of artisan craftsmanship with a contemporary vision continues to be the essence of the label, combining amazing fabrics, indulgent colour palettes and creative styling. 

As well as Sahara?s own label, their three-storey boutique showcases unique European designer collections such as Oska, Lauren Vidal, Masai and many more, plus a stunning selection of scarves, bags and jewellery with a difference.

Title: Salvation Army
Body:
As a worldwide Christian church and registered charity, The Salvation Army demonstrates Christian principles through extending a helping hand to people of all ages and backgrounds, who are homeless, friendless and in need. The charity provides disadvantaged people the respect and access to practical, social and spiritual support they need to realise their potential.
The Salvation Army?s services are open to anyone who wants to find faith or share their faith, whether it?s to pop in for a coffee or to take a look at one of their many activities on offer.

Title: Santander
Body:
Santander UK plc, a part of the Santander Group, is a leading financial services provider in the UK, offering a wide range of personal and commercial financial products and services.

Their success is built on a focus on retail and commercial banking. They have consistently delivered strong financial results with increasing profits and revenues that are balanced by strict cost-management and responsible lending. This has enabled them to be the most efficient financial services provider in the UK(1), committed to offering customers the most innovative and best value-for-money products.

Looking ahead, Santander is extremely well-positioned to continue to grow, with expansion focused primarily through organic means, while assessing selected acquisition opportunities as they arise.

In August 2010 they agreed to purchase the parts of the banking businesses of the Royal Bank of Scotland which are carried out through its RBS branches in England and Wales, and by its NatWest branches in Scotland. In addition, they aim to do more business with their 26 million existing customers, rewarding them for their loyalty to Santander.

The combination of Santander UK plc's retail and corporate banking presence is a powerful one: with a distribution capability across more than 1,400 branches and 25
 
Corporate Business Centres combined with a broadening commercial product range. They are organised into four main business divisions:

Retail Banking: offers residential mortgages, savings products, banking services (including current accounts), and other personal financial products to customers throughout the UK.
 
Corporate Banking: offers banking services principally to the Small and Medium-sized enterprises (SME) market.

Global Banking & Markets: provides financial markets sales, trading and risk management services to corporate clients in the UK, as well as originating structured products for retail customers.

Private Banking: offers private banking services for retail and corporate clients, and specialist banking services (including onshore and offshore savings accounts, execution-only stockbroking and marketing of structured products).

Title: Savers
Body:
Savers aims to be the most competitively priced health & beauty products and household goods retailer on the high street. Its clean, crisp store settings with friendly, well-trained employees focus on retailing high-quality brand-name products. Most stores now have fine fragrance counters, selling high quality, good value ladies and gents fragrances.

Savers' commitment to all aspects of store operation gives it a competitive edge in offering value and quality to the customer. Stores are carefully laid out to provide an ideal retail environment, focusing on tidiness, cleanliness and consistency.

Title: Scandinavia Coffee House
Body: A delightful coffee house and local restaurant located in the historic town centre.

Title: Scotts Opticians
Body: Scotts opticians and contact lens practice is an independent opticians, operating since 1921. The team prides itself on its quality of service and professionalism, whilst the store offers one of the widest selection of designer frames and sunglasses in Bury St Edmunds. An excellent range of quality and budget frames are on offer.

Title: Scrivens Opticians
Body:
Scrivens Opticians has been, and still remains today, a family company built on solid foundations. Always adapting to change in the optical and hearing field, whilst still maintaining the highest standards of customer and staff care. The company?s long term goal has been to put the customer first, and to provide the finest customer care available - something they have been putting into practice for many years now.
 
Experts in eyecare for over 70 years, Scrivens Opticians can take care of
all your family's eyecare and hearing needs.
.    Expert eye examinations
.    Free NHS eyecare
.    Designer frames
.    Free contact lens trials
.    Free hearing health check

Title: Seasalt
Body:
Our newly refurbished shop at 8 Buttermarket opens 6 August 2016 and will offer Seasalt women?s clothing, footwear and accessories. You?ll also find our Cornish Home range, which showcases unique pottery from the iconic St Ives Leach studios, stationary and home fragrance to give your home a little taste of Cornwall. 

Our garments speak of our landscape, people and heritage of Cornwall, it?s what makes us different. Seasalt?s design studio overlooks Falmouth Bay and St Anthony?s lighthouse and our small design team delight each season with an array of beautiful new prints inspired by Cornwall. You won?t find them anywhere else! 

In 2016 we are celebrating our 35th birthday! We have come a long way since we started in 1981 with our little shop in Penzance. Although we now have over 30 shops and over 400 stockists around the country, we are still a family-run business and are still passionate about creating quality garments that have been designed by the sea, for people everywhere.

Title: Seetec
Body:
Seetec is passionately committed to empowering individuals and organisations to release their potential through its employment and training programmes and software solutions.

With a reputation for integrity, innovation and quality its vision is to be recognised as the provider of first choice by job seekers, learners and employers alike.

Founded in 1984, the organisation has grown organically over the last 25 years to become one of the UK?s largest and most experienced providers of Government funded welfare to work and skills training programmes. Seetec helps thousands of people each year to find work or gain qualifications through a diverse portfolio of employability and skills contracts including New Deal, Pathways to Work and Train to Gain.  Employing over 800 staff across a national network of over 60 employment and training centres Seetec?s customers benefit from a wealth of unique experience.

As a leading IT Training and software provider Seetec offers support, training and services to: individuals, training providers, businesses and healthcare organisations, across the UK, through its bespoke IT Training and software solutions. An example of one of its many innovative solutions is ?Provider Enterprise? a product designed to help manage services in the welfare to work and skills training markets.

Seetec values diversity for the positive benefits, which improve and strengthen the business and are committed to creating an environment in which potential and existing employees, customers and learners have equality of opportunity.

Employment Services

Seetec firmly believes that empowering individuals to move off benefits and into sustainable employment is the best route out of poverty and into healthy, happy and fulfilled lives.

Through a UK wide range of employment programmes, delivered primarily on behalf of the Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) and Jobcentre Plus (JCP), Seetec works closely with thousands of jobseekers, employers and partner providers every year to support unemployed and economically inactive individuals into work.


Seetec delivers a variety of Government funded programmes. These include those aimed at the long term unemployed, such as the New Deal programmes, to those designed for people with disabilities and health conditions such as Pathways to Work and New Deal for Disabled People.  Seetec is also one of the largest suppliers of DWP programmes funded by the European Social Fund, offering employability support to disadvantaged jobseekers from all walks of life, helping them to address and overcome those barriers which prevent them from entering sustainable employment.

 
Training Services

Gaining new skills to compete in the labour market and progress within a profession is increasingly vital; Seetec has been delivering a wide range of training programmes since its inception in 1984 and continues to expand delivery in the NVQ and IT training markets.

Seetec is a leading provider of the Skills Funding Agency's (SFA) Train to Gain programme. We deliver this across six regions of the UK, supporting employers' workforces' development objectives and delivering quality NVQ services to meet the learner's needs with a team of experienced, professional Learning and Development Consultants and innovative online learning technologies.

IT Services

As Seetec has grown and diversified over the last 25 years, it's roots as an IT training and software company are still as strong as ever.  Seetec delivers a range of IT certification programmes, with customers benefiting from skilled, knowledgeable tutors and bespoke training materials. 
 
?Provider Enterprise?, Seetec?s proprietary customer management system, is designed specifically for the welfare to work and skills training industries. Originally developed in house for Seetec and its partners it provides an efficient, effective software solution with management information and controls that meet funders? requirements.
Location: Office 1, First Floor,  2A Cornhill, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Sew Creative
Body: Sew Creative has been established in Bury St Edmunds now for over 10 years. Providing excellent customer service and stocking sewing machines from basic models up to stunning top of the range machines, Sew Creative also runs workshops and classes. With classes including quilting, bag-making, dressmaking, home furnishings and more, Sew Creative has regular deliveries of new, current fabrics to keep our range fresh and exciting. Stocking the largest selection of fabrics, haberdashery and knitting yarn in the Bury St Edmunds area, visit Sew Creative, you'll be amazed at the vast range of sewing-related items.

Title: Sewing Studio
Body: Sewing studio including workshops.
Location: 13 St Johns Street, Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, IP33 1SQ

Title: Sheridans Estate Agents
Body:
Sheridans are specialists in the sale of character properties in the East Anglia region, ranging from larger country houses to small period cottages and town houses. They aim to simply offer sound advice to ensure customers receive the best price for their property, whatever the market conditions and prospective buyers receive a helpful service.
 
Their unique approach to selling individual and period homes successfully combines good old fashioned service with the latest technology available including; high quality colour brochures with detailed floorplans, QR codes and a regularly updated website.

Their services include:
�         All Aspects Of Residential Sales   
�         Market Appraisals
�         New Homes Projects   
�         Period & Listed Homes Specialists
�         Local & National Advertising
�         Town Centre Offices
�         Formal & Probate Valuations
�         Friendly Sales Team With A Wealth of    Local Knowledge
 
By selecting Sheridans to assist you with buying or selling your home, you are assured of one of the leading and most successful independent estate agents in the Bury St Edmunds area and they are here to help and advise you through the complete selling and buying process.

Title: Shires Residential
Body:
They specialise in the sale, acquisition, letting and management of residential property in the Bury St Edmunds and Mildenhall areas. The Bury team have recently moved to new offices on Guildhall Street. The team are now located at number 9.

Shires Residential is renowned for high standards of care and consideration for clients and is an independent estate agency that has extensive local market knowledge, experience and integrity, which make it well placed to provide a service to property owners for all their property related requirements.

They understand that moving home can be a stressful and complex undertaking and they are on hand to assist in every step of the transaction whether you are buying, selling, letting or renting.

Their Mildenhall office is conveniently located for the United States Air Force Bases at RAF Mildenhall and RAF Lakenheath and this advantage, together with their considerable expertise in the letting market, has made Shires one of the leading rental and management agents in the area.

Their range of additional services includes Land & New Homes, Search & Acquisition and Investment purchase for clients, and also Buy to Let advice.

Title: Shoe Zone
Body:
Shoezone is a footwear retailer that sells rather a lot of shoes, approximately 30 million pairs a year to be exact! The thriving business has over 570 stores within the UK and Republic of Ireland, continuing its main aim to be the number one value shoe retailer in the country.
Keeping prices low to help you spend less, the average price is 40% of the national average of �20!
Whilst developing great value, quality products, Shoezone offers a friendly, efficient, well-trained team and carries a strong commitment to the environment; recycling over 65% of its waste and reducing the number of carrier bags used.

Title: Shoephoric
Body:
Shoephoric, an independent shoe retailer, provides stylish and comfortable footwear for all the family in the Suffolk towns of Bury St Edmunds and Stowmarket.

For women they offer quality brands including Josef Seibel, Ecco, Gabor, Gerry Weber, Rieker, Romika, Birkenstock, Tamaris and Pikolinos. For men brands include Josef Seibel, Ecco, Steptronic, Timberland, Camel Active, Bugatti, Loake and Barkers.

For children their trained fitters have access to up to 7,000 pairs of shoes from brands including Clarks, Start Rite and Timberland and offer a loyalty scheme with discounts on futures purchases. The stores also offer a unique first shoe experience for those first pair of shoes, with a fridge magnet photograph, free pair of socks and a discount card.

The independent business strives to offer all the family shoe euphoria from comfort footwear that doesn't compromise on style in a modern environment!

Title: Six
Body:
Six, in the heart of Bury St Edmunds, stocks brands that at their very heart survive on a passion for quality and provenance.
