The brand wants you to know and have faith that when you are buying from them, you not only acquire a great garment but more importantly you are investing in an ideal ? the ideal that skills and craftsmanship need to be treasured and protected and that industry based around these ideals should be supported to encourage further advancement.
 
In this modern world we have the ability to source items from across the globe made by people with a plethora of talent. Six has invested in this concept, something real and worthwhile.
 
Six provides a fresh shopping experience. An eclectic mix of brands, unique style of the store and product knowledge of our staff is unrivalled, and is why Six is rapidly becoming a destination store of choice for men throughout the UK. A one-to-one personal shopping service is also available seven days a week.

Title: SK Clinic + Spa
Body:
SK Clinic + Spa is an award-winning boutique 5-Bubble day spa based in the heart of Bury St Edmunds offering guests an extensive menu of bespoke spa treatments and exceptional spa care.

The Observer Magazine has recommended SK as a top spa to visit in the UK praising the treatments for "making dull skin radiant" while Glamour magazine advised that "...you'll leave with a fresh glow".

SK was a finalist in The Good Spa Guide Awards 2011 and won both the Pure Relaxation Highly Commended Velvet Award 2011 and the Bury St Edmunds' Best Health & Beauty Business 2010 Award.

A rich and progressive treatment menu offers something for every guest with options ranging from facials, massages and body wraps to essential beauty services to bespoke spa and bridal packages.

A chic dual treatment room gives couples, family and friends the option of enjoying their spa experiences side-by-side. Described by The Good Spa Guide as "immaculate, stylish and serene"  SK invites you to retreat into a warm, welcoming atmosphere dedicated to expert skin care, complete relaxation and divine wellbeing.
Location: Victory Chapel, 4 Northgate Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Smart Step
Body:
Smart Step is an independently owned business offering shoe repairs, key cutting, engraving, watch repairs and battery replacements.
 
The shop also stocks Pierre Cardin and Zippo lighters as well as a range of gifts for weddings and christenings and a shoe shop opened upstairs in the summer of 2013.

The shop has launched 10% off vouchers, a business discount scheme and a loyalty card scheme.

Title: Smiggle
Body:
Smiggle, the world?s hottest stationery brand, was born in 2003. The ultimate creators of colourful, fun, fashion-forward stationery. The first Smiggle store opened in Melbourne, Australia and word spread fast about the bright pens, notebooks and gadgets that filled a tiny, but very special place. The concept took off and the company soon hit 20 stores, where it caught the eye of the Just Group - Australasia's most exciting fashion & apparel retailer. Smiggle joined the Just Group in August 2007 and has not looked back since! In 2008 Smiggle jumped the seas and opened its first international store in New Zealand. In 2011 Smiggle expanded into Singapore, and in 2014 Smiggle opened its doors in the UK! It's all part of the grand plan to be the world's most exciting and famous stationery brand. 

The product range is now bigger and better than ever, with the team at the Smiggle Design Lab drawing inspiration from all over the globe. Our ultimate goal is to inspire and develop the creative spirits of our customers, by delivering original, fun and affordable stationery. Smiggle products are all about great design and innovation, bold colour, quirky graphics, great value and most of all - giving our fans the tools they need to have fun!
Location: Unit 22A Arc Shopping Centre, 14 Prospect Row, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Sneezums
Body:
Established in 1874, Sneezums - Jewellers and Photographic Retailers, can claim to be one of the oldest family run businesses in Bury St Edmunds.
 
At Sneezums, we pride ourselves on the personal service we offer our customers, providing good quality products at competitive prices.
 
If you're looking for the ideal gift come and visit our store in the Cornhill, Bury St Edmunds (near the arc shopping centre). See our impressive range of products from classic Jewellery to the latest digital cameras. Our friendly and knowledgeable staff are here to help.

Title: So Bar
Body:
So Bar is anything but just another bar!

It is a great place for morning coffee, light lunches, as well as fine wines, cocktails & beers from around the world. They have free wi-fi, children are welcome during the day & you can enjoy our fantastic outside seating area as you watch the world go by.

Established in 2005 and having undergone a major refurbishment in 2011, So Bar is one of the most popular places for a night out in Bury St Edmunds with a relaxed & upmarket feel to it. Live music can be heard every Thursday night with their ?Unplugged? sessions. If you have a smart phone, check vouchercloud for our weekly offers.

Title: Sounds Plus
Body: West Suffolk's only specialist guitar store, Sounds Plus is literally one of a kind. At Sounds Plus you will find a wide range of new and second hand electric, acoustic and bass guitars, amplifiers, effects and a vast array of guitar accessories and music books. Also stocking a small selection of ukuleles and strung folk instruments, microphones and drum and percussion accessories, the small team of guitar enthusiasts are dedicated to creating the best possible customer experience for everyone.
Location: 8 Risbygate Street, Bury St. Edmunds, Suffolk

Title: Specsavers
Body:
Why do one in three people who wear glasses choose Specsavers? It's simple - whether you are in store or online they offer an unbeatable combination of style, value for money and expertise.

You can be sure to find the glasses that are just right for you - their online catalogue of over 1500 glasses is the widest selection in the UK and they're always sourcing the latest materials and following fashions from around the world to bring you an unequalled choice of the latest fashions, designer labels, materials, colours and frame shapes.

Great value for money - glasses from �25
?for �25 choose from over 30 styles
?for �45 or under choose from over 120 styles
?for �99 choose two pairs of their top designer frames including names such as FCUK, French Connection and Red or Dead.

And don't forget their prices include PENTAX standard single vision lenses and a scratch-resistant treatment.

Trust the experts: When you choose Specsavers Opticians you are in safe hands - every year, for nine years running, the readers of Readers Digest have voted them the most trusted opticians' brand in the UK.

Title: Sports Direct
Body: Sports Direct have amazing cheap deals on the latest trainers, football boots, football shirts, sportswear and equipment.

Title: St Edmunds Butchers
Body:
Offering top class customer service and high quality meats and game, St Edmunds Butchers continues to bring you the meat you need for your family.
 
Over the past 20 years the butcher's shop has served Bury St Edmunds, and is now under new ownership.
 
Sourcing locally produced pheasants, partright, venison and other game to give you top quality seasonal food for your table, we ensure you can buy locally whilst maintaining the highest of standards expected.
 
We also offer a refrigerated delivery service covering a 16 mile radius of Bury St Edmunds. For more information ring 01284 768351.

Title: St Edmundsbury Cathedral
Body: Built along side the Benedictine Abbey dedicated to St Edmund, and overlooking the Abbey Gardens, this church became a cathedral in 1914. The Cathedral building has continued to develop over recent years with the addition of the Millennium Tower, completed in 2005, and its magnificent painted and gilded vault, added in 2010. Guided tours available. Refectory and Shop.
Location: The Cathedral Office, Abbey House, Angel Hill, Bury St Edmunds

Title: St Edmundsbury Financial Services Ltd
St John's Church
Body:
St John?s is an Anglican catholic church with a clearly affirming and inclusive approach. The church is located in St John?s Street, and was built in 1841. 

We welcome a wide mixture of ages and backgrounds into our welcoming and friendly community. Our main Sunday service is the Parish Mass at 11.00am, where music is enhanced by the recently restored organ and an accomplished organist. Laying on of hands and anointing for healing is available at the end of the service each Sunday.  

A range of other services takes place throughout the week, including Eucharists on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays. Children can receive Holy Communion before confirmation, after proper preparation. 

The sacrament is reserved and the church is open every day for those who want time and space to pray and think. 

The church is an active supporter of Children in Distress, Town Pastors, Christian Aid, Us, The Children's Society and several other charities. 

The Centre next door to St John?s church is available for hire. It hosts the Just Traid shop, a community caf� and a growing number of community activities and groups.
Location: St John�s Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: St Mary's Church
Body: Part of Bury?s Benedictine Abbey site, this remarkable 14th century church claims to be England?s third largest parish church, and to have England?s second longest aisle and its largest west window. The hammer beam roof with its angel carvings, and the tomb of Mary Tudor, Queen of France and sister of Henry VIII, also make it well worth visiting.
Location: Parish Office, St Mary's Church, Honey Hill, Bury St Edmunds IP33 1RT

Title: St Nicholas Hospice Care
Body:
St Nicholas Hospice provide practical, medical and spiritual support to local people and their families living with an illness that is life threatening; such as cancer, multiple sclerosis, motor neurone disease, heart or lung disease.

The charity shops are used to raise the money needed to run the charity. The shops are full of outstanding pre-loved furniture, clothes, bric?a?brac, books and household items.

The shops are always looking for good quality donations.
Location: 87 St John\'s Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Starbucks Coffee
Body:
To say Starbucks purchases and roasts high-quality whole bean coffees is very true.
 
That?s the essence of what they do ? but it hardly tells the whole story.

Their coffeehouses have become a beacon for coffee lovers everywhere. Why do they insist on Starbucks? Because they know they can count on genuine service, an inviting atmosphere and a superb cup of expertly roasted and richly brewed coffee every time.
They?re not just passionate purveyors of coffee, but everything else that goes with a full and rewarding coffeehouse experience. They also offer a selection of premium Tazo� teas, fine pastries and other delectable treats to please the taste buds. And the music you hear in store is chosen for its artistry and appeal. 

It?s not unusual to see people coming to Starbucks to chat, meet up or even work. They?re a neighbourhood gathering place, a part of the daily routine ? and they couldn?t be happier about it. Get to know them and you?ll see: they are so much more than what they brew.

Title: Starlings Toymaster
Body:
Starlings Toymaster is an independently owned toystore which prides itself on the wide range of toys and the knowledge of its staff.

Formed under the national toystore, Toymaster, Starlings continues to welcome girls and boys of all ages looking for the perfect treat or birthday gift. 

Offering competitive prices and our friendly staff, Starlings is able to help you find the right toy that is suitable to your child and budget.

Title: Steamer Trading Cookshop
Body:
Steamer Trading Cookshop carries one of the widest ranges of kitchenware to be found in the world - over 10,000 items from all the best names in kitchenware. They offer a carefully thought out selection from the basics such as saucepans, knives and all the items that make a kitchen the heart of the home, to hard-to-find items like zabaglione pans, salamanders or even a duck press. 

They love to offer advice on products that they sell and their use, and will be quick to demonstrate anything from espresso machines to food mixers. Please visit any of their shops or call, or email them - they're always happy to be asked for help. 
Their special order service will track down most items that you could name - and probably some that you can't!
Location: 78-79 St John\'s Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Stewart House Orthodontics
Body: A skilled and friendly team uses state-of-the-art technology to ensure you receive the best possible comprehensive care.

Title: Stormfront
Body: Visit us at our Bury St Edmunds store in the Arc shopping Centre today and have a chat with one of our experienced Apple experts. We'd love to show you the latest Apple products and accessories to help find what?s right for you.
Location: Arc Shopping Centre, 9 Auction St, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Street Level Cafe
Body: Traditional English cafe restaurant, serves breakfast all day, fish and chips, and ice cream all year round.
Location: Street Level Cafe, 29 Abbeygate Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Subway
Body: The Subway restaurant chain is the world's largest submarine sandwich franchise, with more than 31,500 locations in 91 countries.

Title: Suffolk Carver
Body: A small independently run cafe, serving a selection of teas, coffees and homemade scones and cakes. Their breakfast menu offers quality ingredients and great value. Their lunch time menu offers a variety of hot and cold filled baguettes, roast pork with all the trimmings - their speciality! They also have jacket potatoes with homemade fillings, a special chicken panini which is renowned in the town and homemade soup. Take away is also available.

Title: Suffolk Jewellery & Antiques
Body: A local family-run independent jewellery shop, established in 1978. Selling new and second hand diamond set jewellery and a large selection of 9 carat gold chains and bracelets, in yellow and white gold. Certificated diamonds supplied and set to your own custom design. Also in stock are secondhand watches by Rolex, Cartier, Breitling, Omega and Tag Heuer. Daily jewellery repairs undertaken on the premises and they also do valuations for insurance and probate. They are interested in buying larger diamond set jewellery, antique rings and pendants, gold bullion including broken jewellery - the highest prices are paid for gold and silver coins. They buy silver articles, small antiques, interesting watches as well as premier brand watches, coins and militaria. Instant decisions, immediate payment.
Location: 73 St John\'s Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Sunrise Direct
Body:
The Sunrise clothing store aims to set a fashion forward footprint on Bury St Edmunds.

The ranges are unique and quirky, providing customers with the exclusive style they need to feel that little bit special.  

Amongst the ultra-stylish menswear and womenswear collections, there is something for everyone.  Yet perhaps the most individual attribute of Sunrise is the fabulous customer service. 

No matter how big or small your purchase the Sunrise staff will always go that extra mile to turn the average shopping trip into an experience to remember. 

In the womenswear department you will be greeted by a friendly face and a choice of gorgeous brands such as  Fever, Culture, Bohemia, Amari, Dr Martens and many more! With such beautiful clothes, interesting accessories and expert advice you just can't go wrong.  

For the guys there is a superb range of trainers from brands such as DC & Globe, and exclusive clothing ranges from favourites such as Bench, Carhartt, Element & Blend of America.  So take a trip to Sunrise for something that little bit different!

Title: Superdrug
Body: Leading health and beauty retailer offering expert knowledge in cosmetics, fine fragrance and skin care. A fully trained pharmacist is on site to offer a wide range of services in store as well as a prescription collection service for the town and surrounding areas.

Title: Swarovski
Body: For over a century, Swarovski has continually grown to become the world leader for sparkling crystal creations. Their mission is to add sparkle to your everyday life. Swarovski offers an array of collections which include jewellery, fashion accessories, watches, figurines, and home accessories.

Title: TC2
Body:
TC2 is a stylish, contemporary jewellers in the heart of Bury St Edmunds stocking some of the leading innovative brands such as Thomas Sabo and their Karma Bead collection and Charm Club. We are also stockists for Links of London including their glamorous Stardust bracelets, sitting alongside contemporary necklaces in the Hope and Essentials ranges.
 
We have recently introduced Claudia Bradby Jewellery to our range. With its modern pearl and semi-precious necklaces, earrings and beautiful bracelets, the range is available to suit many occasions.
 
For that special ceremony or occasion, we can help you add a touch of sparkle with jewellery from Babette Wasserman and White Ice.
 
In our welcoming store, we also have a wide range of silver jewellery from Rachel Galley, Old Florence, Lovelinks and Tianguis Jackson as well as the stylish Danish designed Skagen watches.
Location: 16 High Baxter Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Tesco Express
Body:
Offering everything you would want from a supermarket and more, Tesco Express is perfect for all of your daily shopping essentials. From fresh produce, to groceries, to bread baked on the premises, to wine and spirits, Tesco Express provides the community of Bury St Edmunds with great value, quality and fresh food close close to where people live and work.
 
Open 17 hours every day of the week, Tesco Express really is a convenient way to shop.
Location: 24-26 St Andrew Street South, Bury St Edmunds

Title: The Angel Hotel
Body:
The 4 star Angel Hotel stands in the historic town square of Bury St.Edmunds. While retaining its Georgian charm, this stylish hotel is full of interesting art and design. This Suffolk hotel has a non-traditional style and professional yet relaxed staff with thoughtful and unpretentious attention to detail.

In the last ten years, the Gough family have lavished attention into the renovation of parts of the hotel. As a result, they have brought it forward from a traditional coaching inn to an exciting and contemporary award-winning hotel. The Angel is perfectly positioned for exploring the charming town of Bury St. Edmunds with its many interesting boutiques.
 
The hotel is also an ideal base for experiencing all that Suffolk has to offer.
 
A flight of stairs will lead you down into our luxurious new bar in the depths of our historic past. Relax within the lavishly dressed splendour of our ancient walls.
Location: 3 Angel Hill, Bury St Edmunds IP33 1LT

Title: The Apex
Body:
The Apex is an award-winning venue, known for its acoustic excellence and 
home to a diverse programme of live music and events; from classical concerts to pop, rock, jazz, blues, world, country and folk, plus comedy and dance performances. 
It also hosts a number of community and corporate events, offering the local community and wider environs a unique and exciting space from which visitors can see a great selection of artists, bands and events. 
It has been very well publicised (and we never tire of hearing it!) that, as well as its architectural beauty, The Apex also has the very best acoustics, with many musicians who've played here describing it as the best acoustic in the UK, if not Europe:
"Best new venue in the UK. Absolutely superb" - Funeral For A Friend
"Best acoustic we?ve had in 40 years of touring" - Fairport Convention
"The best hall we have ever played in" - The Escher String Quartet

Title: The Apex Cafe
Body: The Apex Caf� is located on the ground floor of the Apex. Renowned for selling ?great tea and coffee that does great things?, it provides ethically-sourced products, triple certified by the Fair Trade Foundation, the Soil Association and the Rainforest Alliance. The caf� also stocks a selection of freshly-prepared sandwiches and delicious homemade cakes as well as ice cream in the summer. Why not spend an hour people-watching at one of the outside tables or enjoying the buzz of the inside caf�? We?re looking forward to serving you!
Location: The Apex, 1 Charter Square, Bury St Edmunds

Title: The Athenaeum
Body:
The Athenaeum was purpose-built in the early 18th century as Assembly Rooms where the locals could gather to play cards, read books, attend parties and generally have a good time; not that different from its use today! It was re-named The Athenaeum in 1854 and is a Grade I listed building comprising a number or spaces available for hire, including the ornate Georgian Ballroom, its chandeliered ceiling and grand d�cor being reminiscent of the days of Pride and Prejudice. Now owned by St Edmundsbury Borough Council and managed in association with the Council?s catering partners, Sodexo Prestige, it is well known as a ?local venue for local people?, playing host to wedding receptions, balls, conferences, dinners and much, much more.
The Athenaeum with its splendid frontage stands proudly in Angel Hill ? physically, very much in the centre of historic Bury St Edmunds and intellectually, right at the heart of much of Bury?s history. The building is adjacent to St Edmundsbury Cathedral, the impressive, 12th century Norman Tower and the magnificent Abbey Gate, which was of course the entrance to the Abbey grounds where once stood one of the most powerful and influential monasteries in England. It is also right next to the Angel Hotel where Dickens stayed in 1859 and 1861 when he was giving readings in the Athenaeum. The Bury St Edmunds branch holds a lovely letter from Dickens, thanking his friend Mr Thompson, who was at the time the proprietor of the subscription rooms (now the Athenaeum) and who had arranged for him to read from David Copperfield.
A feature of the Athenaeum which is of particular interest is a fair-sized, domed observatory on the roof, containing a telescope. A lecture on Astronomy was held by Sir James Airy, 7th Astronomer Royal in October 1858, at which time, by happy coincidence, the impressive Donati?s comet happened to be looming large in the night sky. These two events combined, so inspired members of the Institute that they felt moved to build the observatory! Airy advised on the design of the dome and choice of telescope to furnish it, which was to be enjoyed by the thriving Astronomical Society that arose to utilise it. The observatory today has fallen into disrepair, but still exists as a fantastic time capsule of Victorian astronomy.

Title: The Beerhouse
Body:
The Beerhouse serves a wide selection of great cask ales as well as some European beers, carefully selected wines and simple pub food in a clean, friendly and traditional pub environment. 
 
With 8 hand pumps dedicated to cask ale and an ever changing range of beers from interesting local to national brewers, The Beerhouse welcomes all to enjoy an afternoon of relaxation whilst catching up with friends. 
 
Also introducing its very own Brewshed beers to the range in 2011, you?re sure to find a taste to suit you, amidst the full range of beers, ales, stout and ciders. 
 
Offering a great outdoor space with seating for over 50 people, enjoy a beer in the sun or sit back an enjoy one of the simple but tasty dishes from the bar snacks menu.

Title: The Bodhi Tree
Body:
The Bodhi Tree has been the site of a chemists/herbalists for many years and is situated in an 18th-century building in the heart of Bury St Edmunds. The store stocks: 
 
- Natural remedies
- Special dietary foods
- Speciality tea and coffee beans
- Wholefoods
 
The small shop front hides a huge range of products and is one of the many independent retailers which make Bury such a delightful and different  place to visit.
 
The Bodhi Tree situated in The Traverse ? a traffic-free area in the middle of the town between Cornhill and The Buttermarket.
Location: 9 The Traverse, Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk

Title: The Body Sanctuary
Body:
The Body Sanctuary is a small, professional beauty salon in Bury St Edmunds.

Set in a beautiful 16th Century building infused with the aroma of essential oils they offer a wide range of treatments and therapies and take great pride in providing you with a friendly and calm environment for you to visit and relax in while their professional and experienced therapists help you to feel refreshed and revived.
 
They have three comfortable treatment rooms staffed by their friendly and highly qualified therapists. Clients have often commented on the relaxed and pleasant atmosphere and they strongly believe in offering a personal service to help you make the most of your relaxation time.
Location: 16 St John's Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: The Body Shop
Body: The Bodyshop believes that trading with principles and passion can help to safeguard our planet and those who depend on it. Believing it to be the best way to convince others is to lead by example, the business? corporate philosophy states 'natures way to beautiful' represents its unique and highly regarded heritage. With a wide range of customer, The Body Shop aims to offer customers of all ages products that inspire and delight.

Title: The Bushel
Body:
There has been a pub, or an inn, in the same spot in St John Street since the 15th century. In fact a part of the original flint wall is still on show in the dining area providing a visible part of history as you dine.

As the large number of regulars demonstrate, The Bushel is a popular pub in the neighbourhood. Friendly and atmospheric it's very welcoming to newcomers. There is a separate dining area, with full table service in an attractive setting with white walls and natural light coming through the glass ceiling, they serve good and honest pub grub that really does hit the spot.
Location: 28-29 St John\'s Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: The Cathedral Shop
Body: The Cathedral Shop is located on Angel Hill and is open 7 days a week. It stocks gifts, souvenirs, greetings cards, books,  CDs, jewellery and local food products. The shop is open Monday to Saturday 10 am to 7pm, Sundays 11.30 am to 4pm.
Location: Cathedral Office, Abbey House, Angel Hill, Bury St Edmunds

Title: The Centre
Body:
The Centre is a welcoming town centre venue offering three spaces for hire. We are suitable for a wide range of uses and offer favourable rates for charities/community services and activities.
 
Our aim is that The Centre is accessible to all. It has been designed to be wheelchair friendly with a level access WC and wide doorways. We have a hearing loop and baby changing facilities. The Centre also houses the Just Traid shop and caf�. 

The building is a beautifully restored former school with period features. Naturally light and airy with high ceilings and wooden floors; it also has exposed brickwork, contemporary colours and lighting. We are five minutes? walk of bus and railways stations and long stay car parking. 

Our Charity Bury St. Edmunds Ecumenical Centre Trust (BECT) is a registered charity (1099687) and was set up specifically to support The Centre as a local education and community centre. It leases the building from St John?s School Centre Trust and is governed by appointed Trustees. 

The Charity aims to improve the health and well-being of everyone in the community and encourage them to take part in a range of activities, services and facilities within The Centre, as well as preserve the building as a community venue. The charity's overall mission is one of Christian service and witness to the community. Through the activities of the Just Traid shop and caf� we also seek to relieve poverty, particularly in developing countries.
Location: The Centre, St John\'s Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: The CodFather
Body:
The Codfather is a popular fish and chip shop in the heart of Bury St Edmunds.
 
Offering everything from the Nation's favourite cod and chips to haddock and battered sausages, they sell something for every fish and chip lover.
Location: 1 St. Andrews Street North, Bury St Edmunds, IP33 1TZ

Title: The Corn Exchange Wetherspoons
Body:
This exquisite grade I listed 19th century building has been a landmark in Bury St Edmunds since it first opened as The Corn Exchange in 1862. Wetherspoons began refurbishing the building in 2011 ensuring that the majority of the original features still remain and are preserved. Local artists were also involved in the project to ensure their customers have a full knowledge of the heritage of the site. The exterior has remained largely untouched, it is upon entering the building that the changes are apparent. The first floor is a grand room with a high glass ceiling, long marble bar and plenty of table space.
 
Their bespoke menu offers breakfast and a large selection of traditional English meals as well as weekly offers such as ?Steak Night,? ?Curry Club? and a traditional Sunday Roast. Lighter options available are; wraps, salads and sandwiches. Their drinks include a vast range of real ales most of which are locally sourced, sixteen different lagers and an extensive selection of spirits and wines. Their friendly staff and beautiful surroundings provide a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere.

Title: The Fox Inn
Body:
The Fox Inn is a gorgeous 15th century Inn and Restaurant with boutique rooms in a converted historic barn. The venue offers...
 
- Friendly and relaxed dining
- Ideal meeting place for business or pleasure
- Chefs daily specials and scrumptious desserts
- Good selection of vegetarian options. All soups and desserts are also suitable for vegetarians
- Special occasion buffets, lunches and dinners
- Seasonal Business Lunches
- Six individually decorated, large comfortable Boutique bedrooms, fitted with air conditioning and under floor heating.

Title: The Grapes
Body: The Grapes enjoys a central location right in the heart of Bury St Edmunds. It is closely located to the arc shopping centre and offers great value for money food offers like two meals for �8.00 and an OAP menu. They have a comfortable heated courtyard which is used all year round. The Grapes is famous for its weekend rock bands and other entertainment during the week which ranges from karaoke to open mic nights. With a late license at the weekends they offer something for everyone.

Title: The Gym Sports Bar
Body:
The Gym Sports Bar & Grill ? Does exactly what it says on the tin!

A sports bar dedicated to televising Premiership Football, Rugby Union, Cricket, Athletics, Motorsport, Tennis, American Sports & pretty much anything you can think of! They also are the only venue in Bury showing live 3pm kick offs on a Saturday afternoon.
You shouldn?t miss any of the action anywhere in the bar with 11 HD screens, a 6ft projector, TV in the beer garden & even a 50? TV in the men?s toilet. 

They have a fantastic menu from which you can enjoy a light bite to a full on Lean Mean Gym Burger as you watch the action.

Every Friday ?The Gym Rocks?, literally! They showcase the best live bands on their stage each week from 10pm onwards.

Saturday night comes alive each week with their resident DJ playing tunes from the 70?s until the present day until 3am!

For their weekly listings of what?s being shown at The Gym visit their website.

Title: The Lounge Coffee Co
Body: One of the town's most stylish caf�s situated in Bury St Edmund's prestigious Hatter Street.

Title: The Mason Arms
Body:
The Masons Arms is located in the centre of the historic town of Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk. Having undergone a major refurbishment in 2013,  Greene King has transformed the pub into a flagship for their ales whilst retaining many of the original features.

The building dates back to the early 16th century. The Masons Arms is a lovely place to enjoy a drink or a night out where the range of Ale is one of the largest in the town and includes several guest ales and all of the new range of Greene King Micro-brewed ales.
They are also well known for their delicious food all freshly prepared by the talented kitchen team. Expect traditional home-cooked food with a Specials board which  includes seasonal favorites such as Curry Of The Day, Fresh Fish and Vegetarian dishes. They can cater for buffets and parties , can take reservations for tables on 01284 753955.
 
The pub boasts a floral courtyard garden, lush with Ivy and flowers and a glorious sun trap during the summer months. The garden also has Bury town centers only outside bar called "The Masons Elbow",  where in the summer months you can enjoy the sunshine without the need to go inside for your drinks.
They have also been awarded the Five Paw award so you are more than welcome to bring your dog with you.

Title: The Northgate
Body:
The Northgate is redefining the boutique experience. The historic house, located just a few moments? walk from Bury?s iconic ancient Abbey, has undergone extensive renovation resulting in the creation of one of the country?s finest boutique Houses. ?

Ten uniquely styled rooms are complemented with both relaxed and refined dining experiences, alongside a contemporary cocktail bar. 

Bedrooms
An opulent French theme runs throughout The Northgate?s ten individually styled bedrooms. Chestnut's interior design team has cleverly combined The Northgate?s charming period features including original fireplaces and sash windows with modern twists of luxury. ?Free standing over-sized baths, decadent padded headboards, marble tiles, fine linen and ornate mirrors lie in wait for guests at The Northgate. 
 
Dining
We?ve developed a range of relaxed and refined menus that will cater for all tastes throughout the day. Whether you?re wanting to kick the day off with a hearty Suffolk breakfast or a healthy smoothie, indulge in a mid-morning cake with your coffee, or enjoy a casual lunch, The Northgate is the perfect environment to sit back, relax and enjoy delicious local ingredients prepared to the highest standards. ?The evening menu features Modern European dishes expertly created by our renowned Head Chef Dan Grigg.
 
Chefs Table
The Northgate is home to Bury St Edmund?s first ever Chef?s Table where up to 12 guests will have the chance to witness first-hand the mastery of Head Chef Dan Grigg and his team at work as they create a specially prepared tasting menu. ?Using the finest local ingredients combined with Dan?s award winning techniques, the Chef?s Table is the ultimate dining experience for food lovers.
 
Bar and Terrace
Working with a team of the country?s leading mixologists and sommeliers, The Northgate has created a stunning drinks offering. While serving a full range of the world?s leading wines, the finest ales and organic soft drinks throughout the day, The Northgate will turn the spotlight onto its stunning cocktail menu in the evenings. ?The carefully curated cocktail menu is inspired by four central themes: locally sourced ingredients; adventurous drinks that carry a theatrical twist of the unexpected; classic cocktails with a contemporary twist; and those made with surprising flavour combinations.

We look forward to sharing The Northgate experience with you.

Title: The Norman Tower
Body:
The Norman Tower, which was the principal gateway into Bury St Edmunds' great abbey church, houses a fine peal of twelve bells (with a thirteenth semitone bell).
The original ten bells were cast by Thomas Osborn of Downham Market in 1785. The heaviest bell, the 'tenor', weighs just over 27 hundredweight and sounds a C# note. In 1973 the bells were re-hung by Taylors of Loughborough in a cast iron frame lower down the tower, with their original wooden frame preserved higher up. In 2010 an appeal was launched to augment the bells to a cathedral ring of 12, and two new trebles (lighter bells) were dedicated on Easter Sunday 2012, then hung and rung for the first time on Easter Monday. In 2013, a 13th bell was added. This helps learner ringers, as there is a requirement to learn on 8 bells before progressing to higher numbers (10 and 12) - a ring of 10 bells contains within it only 1 true octave, that comprising the 8 heaviest bells, but the provision of a 13th (semitone) bell makes a lighter octave available in the ring of 12.
Approximately 175 full peals have been rung since records began in November 1879. The bells are rung on Sundays from 9.00 am for the 10 o'clock Eucharist, and quarter peals are regularly rung before Sunday evensong. The bells are also rung for weddings and other special occasions. 
The tower is regularly open to the public for the National Heritage Open Day event in September.

Title: The Nutshell
Body: Proud to be known as the smallest pub in Britain, The Nutshell, in the heart of Bury St Edmunds, has been serving beer since 1867. Its interior is not only remarkable for the tiny, cosy bar, which measures just 15ft by 7ft, but also houses an unusual collection of photos and other memorabilia.
Location: The Nutshell Pub, The Traverse, Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk

Title: The One Bull
Body:
The One Bull know that not everyone wants the same thing from a pub. You might want a pint of local real ale at the bar, a bottle of wine and a grazing board on the sofas, a meal in the dining room, a really good coffee and a read of the paper - take your pick.
If real ale is your thing, look no further. They offer their own Brewshed Best Bitter and Pale Ale plus a couple of guest ales.

They?re passionate about wine and have created a list which offers a selection of old favourites combined with some more unusual and quirky wines. The common theme is that they believe they are all well made wines offering good value for money. Every single one of their wines are available by the glass. 

On the food side, the emphasis is on good quality, seasonal produce and, wherever possible, they source it locally. They?ve taken this a step further with smoked salmon as they smoke our own on the premises. They love Sunday lunch and offer a great roast ? bring the family or meet up with friends and catch up on your week.

They?re open from noon until late. So if you?re in need of a fairtrade organic coffee in the afternoon, you know where to come.

Title: The Parsley Pot
Body:
The Parsley Pot is a family run business that has been in the town for 25 years. Their policy is to provide memorable giftware for every occasion, at the same time as providing you with a friendly, reliable service that will leave you feeling enriched and stress free.  
The store provides a shopping experience both in store and online at www.theparsleypot.com with a great range of products from labels such as Emma Bridgewater, Jellycat Toys, Willow Tree, Sophie Allport, Think Pink, Orange Tree Toys, Bombay Duck and many more. 
So if you're looking for Wedding Gifts, Christening Gifts or New Baby Gifts, or just treating yourself or your home to something beautiful you'll find yourself spoilt for choice.

Title: The Perfume Shop
Body:
As the second largest fragrance retailer in the country, The Perfume Shop offers an extensive range of male and female scents from top brands and designers.
 
With a personal and individual customer service, The Perfume Shop makes finding the perfect scent for you, or for a loved one, an easy and enjoyable experience.
Location: Unit 26, The Arc Shopping Centre, Bury St Edmunds

Title: The Rose of Bengal
Body: The Rose of Bengal will give you a warm welcome, with its tastefully decorated fully licensed and air conditioned restaurant. Whether you are looking to have a romantic meal for two, a business lunch or maybe a birthday party, the staff at the Rose of Bengal will make your visit perfect in every way possible - they believe that it takes more than just exquisite food to make a wonderful restaurant.

Title: The Sheesh
Body: Turkish BBQ restaurant on Risbygate Street.

Title: The Snug
Body:
Our story started 10 years ago, when the intention was to create a really friendly neighbourhood bar with something for everyone, serving a fantastic range of quality crafted drinks and craveable grazing food all day, everyday. Since then our Snug family has grown and we have over 100 fantastic local team members working with us, passionate about making sure our guests have a great time.
 
We serve feel-good homemade comfort food everyday from early till late. From hearty breakfasts served all day to build your own sharing platters, signature homemade burgers, fresh salads and more. 
 
Our Bury St Edmunds bar and restaurant is one of 10 locations and will be home to our best food and cocktail menus!

To this day our values remain the same; friendly, local and fun. We really appreciate you choosing to spend your time with us and we hope you enjoy it as much as we do!
Location: 88-89 St Johns Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: The Stillery Bar
Body:
The Stillery is Bury St Edmunds' newest bar in what was the upstairs room in The Snug Bar. It's a 'speak-easy' style cocktail bar, with a team passionate about serving a range of top quality drinks.
 
The bar has been fully refurbished into a high-end cocktail and drinks bar with table service. We have our own still for distilling spirits and will be launching our first offering 'Stillery London Dry Gin' this weekend - so why not come and have a taste! 
 
Always wanted the chance to develop your own gin recipe? Heres your chance? One of our distilling team will teach you the history of gin and where it comes from, what makes a gin and the skills to develop your own flavours. For more information, download the PDF or alternatively visit their website here. 
 
There's limited space in the bar, so you will need to book a table on weekend evenings at booking@stillery.co.uk.

Title: The Whitworth Co-Partnership
Body:
As Architects, they can turn your ideas and dreams into workable designs with flare and imagination, stylish yet practical response to your needs.

As Surveyors they can assess your requirements and project your work within your budgets and time constraints. They can assess the scale of building defects and suggest cost effective remedial work appropriate to the structure, consistent with conservation and sustainable principles.

As historic building consultants they manage expert teams, assessing building pathology and heritage significant. They write readable conservation management statements and work collaboratively with clients and professionals to achieve workable out comes.

As Architects they will manage the project to give maximum value to the client by providing fully detailed design solution, taking care with cost control and managing projects on site, to delivery projects within pre-agreed budgets and time controls. The professional overseeing your project with give you a well run and cost effective outcome to give pleasure and delight.

At WCP they aim to understand the needs and requirements of their clients, and will work closely with you. Being a Practice of both Chartered Architects and Chartered Building Surveyors, they have significant expertise with both traditional buildings and creative new design. They have a wide range of experience and specific fields of interest including building conservation, townscape conservation, analysis of historic building defects, timber frame construction, ecclesiastical reordering, sustainable design, restoration of fire damage, expert witness statements, party wall awards and maintenance management.

They offer a range of survey options for those intending to buy or rent premises, from simple specific defect analysis reports to complex full building surveys, Schedules of Condition and Vendor Surveys, advising clients on what repairs ought to be undertaken before placing a property on the market.

They are prepared to inspect buildings anywhere in the UK and Europe.

Title: The Works
Body:
We stock books, toys, gifts, stationery and arts & crafts at discount prices, and sell over one million of our products every week to consumers looking for a bargain.
 
Our range of products is huge. We sell more than 40,000 different products every year and we appeal to anyone looking for wide variety at great value prices.
 
You can find many big brands at low prices in The Works, but we also develop a great range of our own branded products. 
 
Everyone loves The Works, because you can browse our stores and always find something different - from educational products to great gifts.

Title: Theatre Royal
Body: The Theatre Royal, built by William Wilkins in 1819, is the only surviving example of a Regency theatre in Britain. Restored in 2007, it not only offers a quality, year-round programme of professional drama, music, dance and light entertainment, but also sets out to bring its fascinating heritage to life for contemporary audiences.

Title: Thomas Cook
Body:
With many years of experience, the staff at Thomas Cook, Cornhill, can help you with any holiday requirements, from a romantic honeymoon to a quick city break, from a stag/hen do to a world cruise. 

They can also arrange many UK holidays or just airport car parking or airport overnight hotels- as little or as much as you require. Book an appointment to discuss your needs in their comfortable lounge anytime Monday ? Sunday. They also offer fantastic money services, such as Cash Passport and Money Gram, for all your foreign exchange needs.

Title: Thomson
Body:
At Thomson, they understand that it?s the little things that make the big difference. That?s why they employ nearly 18,000 people to make your holiday special.  They?ve got more staff based around the world than any other travel company, and a huge collection of holidays to choose from. So whether you?re after a cruise or a 5-star hotel, they?ll help you find a break that?s right for you.  

They know everybody likes to do things differently, so as well as 650 stores around the country, they?ve got the UK?s largest travel website, too. Log on and you?ll find over 2,000 hotel and destination videos, plus thousands of customer reviews, podcasts and images to help you plan your trip. They fly from 23 UK airports ? so you can jet off from one that?s nearby. What?s more, you can now tailor-make your stay, with the option of 9, 10, 11 and 12-night holidays, as well as the traditional 7 and 14.

Title: Thorntons
Body:
Caf� Thorntons is a specialised chocolate shop at reasonable prices. We offer a gift-wrapping service and we also offer an icing service to personalise your gifts. 

The caf� is a great place to come and enjoy a coffee or one of our amazing hot chocolates, made from real chocolate. We offer cakes and pastries and we also do an assortment of sandwiches. 

Not forgetting the most important factor a free chocolate for everyone who visits, what could be better?

Title: Thos Peatling
Body:
You will find a great collection of fine and rare wines, selected after careful tasting, whilst also being given the opportunity to discover a wide range of fortified wines, spirits and Greene King beer. 
 
Nicholas and the team pride themselves in providing a friendly and knowledgeable service to satisfy any budget and taste.
 
The team also provides special services for external events and work with a number of restaurateurs and hoteliers.
 
Having just moved to Risbygate Street from Westgate Street, the store is a must-visit location.

Title: Three
Body: Three in Bury St Edmunds provides you with a one-stop-shop for mobile, internet and telephony services.

Title: Thurlow Champness & Sons
Body:
Thurlow Champness & Sons is a luxury county jeweller with customer service being key to its success. The business has 2 shops in the centre of the town housing top brands such as Rolex, Bremont, Ebel, Longines, Citizen, Fope, Mikimoto, Marco Bicego, Georg Jensen, Baccarat, Lalique, Links of London, Thomas Sabo, Old Florence, Babette Wasserman, Lovelinks and Skaagen.

The qualified team undertake all repairs and bespoke design service, and all valuations are completed on the premises.

Title: Timpson
Body: Offering services such as key cutting; non remote and remote car keys; shoe and watch repairs; engraving; photo processing; clothing repair and alterations; dry cleaning and laundry; and photo id and passport photos, Timpson pledges to help with every type of home or business emergency in Bury St Edmunds.

Title: TK Maxx
Body: Our brand spanking new store in Bury St Edmunds is now open. With 2 floors of this season?s one-off pieces and designer gems all up to 60% off the RRP. So here?s to loving your style and living this season for less! See you there treasure seekers!
Location: 2 Robert Boby Way, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Toni and Guy
Body:
TONI&GUY Bury St Edmunds opened in 1999. As a team they have provided clients with the highest standard of haircuts, colours and customer service for over a decade. They are dedicated to providing the ultimate salon experience with a strong team of talented and passionate stylists and technicians who will ensure your TONI&GUY experience is a fabulous one for both you and your hair.
 
All their hairdressers, having completed a minimum of  NVQ2  training, have also achieved the TONI&GUY Diploma which includes six weeks of intensive training on all TONI&GUY methods and techniques at one of their international Academies. Their creative technical team also boasts a wealth of experience with prestigious L?Oreal Colour qualifications.

They offer many additional services such as bridal and occasion hair as well as the super sleek Nanokeratin semi-permanent blow-dry treatment. Clients are also welcome to seek the advice of their Strength in Style consultants in association with Macmillan Cancer Support.
Their wide range of retail products include: label.m professional, Kerastase, GHD and Tangle Teezer to ensure your hair stays salon perfect until your next visit.

Title: Toppers
Body:
More than just a sandwich shop!
 
The shop ? a fast and friendly team, serving made to order bespoke, sandwiches from fresh ingredients, as well other fresh products.
 
Call & Collect ? a speedy service so that customers can pre-order their food and then just drop-in, pay and go-again
 
Drop-in delivery and van sales - operating from Moreton Hall,Fornham and the west side of Bury and we are expanding our number of visits almost daily.
 
Corporate lunch and meeting buffet service - Toppers works closely with corporate clients and companies to offer a full lunchtime or buffet service.
 
Light ? Toppers now offer light alternatives to the standard pastries and sausage rolls by creating " Gem-boats" (Baby gem hearts filled with gorgeous ingredients such as fresh salmon with lemon and dill mayonnaise, a version of a summer-ploughmans, and gluten free tortillas filled with lots of light but tasty ingredients.

Title: Topshop & Topman
Body:
Since launching in 1964, Topshop has become a major style authority and one of fashion?s biggest success stories, appealing to fashion forward shoppers and industry insiders alike.
With over 300 stores in the UK ? including their iconic London flagship store ? 100s of locations around the world, and now the first US store on New York?s Broadway and Broome, Topshop continues to make its mark on the international style map.

Topman has earned its sartorial stripes with an unswerving and energetic approach to producing truly exciting high-street men's fashion. Driving trends forward while shifting the way men approach shopping, the brand's attitude to creating brilliant, affordable and authoritative menswear is second to none.

Born in 1978, Topman is the male equivalent of successful Arcadia stable-mate: Topshop. With a whopping 185 stores in the UK, almost every high street in the country boasts its very own slice of Topman.

Title: Trete Clothing
Body:
Trete is a unique premium clothing boutique that stocks a range of men's and women's brands including their own brand Trete.
 
Trete is a lifestyle brand inspired by the outdoors, every garment is designed and styled to help you grow.
 
From classic basics, including hooded sweaters and T-shirts to iconic leather jackets.
 
The boutique boasts a meditation booth free for all customers to use, there are 5 different introductory meditations to choose, from creativity, to weight loss and abundance all written by Joanna Garzilli.
Location: 80 St John\'s Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Trotter & Deane
Body:
At Trotter & Deane they are proud of their independent status. Keeping pace with developing trends balanced by a philosophy of only selling style that will endure is the essence of their approach to menswear retailing.   

They enjoy achieving the best possible outcome, given your requirements, and offer an ?inhouse? fitting service on all of their ranges at no extra cost. You will find the team both friendly and extremely knowledgeable. They look forward to welcoming you.

Title: Troy Group
Body:
As specialists in sector-specific refurbishments, we focus our expertise exclusively on the hotel, leisure, workplace and living sectors. This means you are assured of the perfect result every time. 

Enhancing projects in the �100k to �3million range, we add value to every project through our specialist knowledge and experience, we provide full refurbishment, design and full turnkey services for individual projects, rollouts and frameworks.
 
We have always built long standing relationships with our clients by ensuring they get the very best service, value and outcome on every project.
Location: The Old Ticket Office, Brentgovel Street, Bury St. Edmunds

Title: TSB
Body:
At TSB, they work hard to be an outstanding provider of savings accounts, offering customers great choice and good value.
 
Whichever TSB savings account you choose, they?ll bring you an efficient, knowledgeable and friendly service.

From traditional branch-based accounts to accounts you can access 24 hours a day, you?ll be able to find something that lets you save the way you want to.

Looking for a mortgage?
160 years, that?s over 1.3 million hours. Imagine the knowledge you could acquire in that time.
 
Well, TSB has been in the mortgage business for over 160 years, so you can safely say they know a thing or two about helping customers find the right mortgage.

TSB mortgages have been tailored to suit most requirements and what they offer is constantly under review and development. That way, they can bring you the solutions you need now and for the future.

Mortgages sold under the TSB and Lloyds Banking brands are a partnership between TSB and Lloyds Bank plc. They are known as TSB mortgages and TSB plc provides the mortgage expertise and runs them, with Lloyds Bank plc as the lender.

Title: Tudor Rose Florist
Body:
Tudor Rose is one of East Anglia's leading florists. Daniel Preston and Pat Green have revolutionised Suffolk's flower scene since they opened their first shop in historic Lavenham in 2002. Since then, they have opened a stylish boutique-style store in Hatter Street, Bury St Edmunds.  

They have built up an unrivalled reputation for cutting edge floristry - sourcing the best quality Dutch flowers and excellent locally-grown seasonal favourites. Regular buying trips to Belgium, Germany and Holland keep them abreast of major European trends - giving Tudor Rose a real continental feel.
The team's expertise makes Tudor Rose the perfect choice for breathtaking wedding flowers, bespoke sympathy designs of real poignancy and stunning gifts for every occasion.

They work at some of the most prestigious venues in the area, including historic Hengrave Hall, near Bury St Edmunds, the Lavenham Swan, Bury's landmark Angel Hotel, Hintlesham Hall, near Ipswich, and Kentwell Hall on the edge of Long Melford. They have also transformed London venues such as the Royal Exchange.

Title: Unique Kitchens & Bedrooms
Body:
Unique Kitchens & Bedrooms has over 15 years experience in designing and creating beautiful kitchen designs, bathroom designs and bedroom designs.
 
Most of its clients are repeat customers or have come to the business through personal, word-of-mouth recommendation. The showroom is based in Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk offering a bespoke design service on kitchens, bedrooms, bathrooms and studies, as well as bespoke interior and furniture solutions for clients throughout Suffolk and East Anglia.
Location: Unique Kitchens & Bedrooms, 2 - 3 Guildhall Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Unison
Body:
UNISON is the largest public sector trade union in the United Kingdom with over 1.3 million members delivering services to people within Local Government, Healthcare, Police Support Staff, Private Contractors, Business and Environment, Education, Community, Voluntary and Housing Associations. There are 12 Regions within UNISON, the Eastern Region of UNISON being one of them. They cover an area that includes Norfolk, Suffolk, Cambridgeshire, Bedfordshire, Hertfordshire and Essex.

Supporting their members in workplaces are both local volunteer representatives and paid staff. So, if their members have issues within their workplace there is always someone that they can go to for help, advice and support. These issues can range from simple advice to dealing with more complex issues such as major employer negotiations, individual or collective grievances and disciplinaries.

In addition as a diverse and as a member led organisation UNISON campaigns on a number of other issues at a local, regional and national level. These issues include: 

    A Million Voices for Change 
    Equal Pay 
    International
    Stop the BNP
    Public Sector Pensions
    Challenging Racism
Location: St Edmunds House,  Lower Baxter Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: United Reformed Church
Body:
As one of the early Separatist churches in England, the church was officially constituted as a ?Church of Religious Dissenters? in 1646. Its history pre-dates this, however, with its association with early martyrs of Congregationalism, Elias Thacker and John Copping, who were hung in 1584 for rejecting Elizabeth I as head of the Church and for disobedience to ecclesiastic law. A memorial to this martyrdom stands in the forecourt of the church. The church has been located in Whiting Street since 1697, the building completed in 1708. Formally part of the Congregational Union of England and Wales, the church has, since 1972, been a part of the United Reformed Church. As a church, it continued to witness to its founding principles, but is also a place of welcome for all. 

Weekly we meet to worship at 10.45am on a Sunday. On a Wednesday we hold a brief service at 9.45am, ideal if you can't make it to church on a Sunday. 

The activities of the church, however, are much wider with regular groups meeting throughout the week, including groups that play scrabble and carpet bowls. There is a parent and toddler group, Tots and Tinies, every Monday in term time and a coffee morning every Wednesday. These sessions, also allow us to work with one of our neighbours, the Info Bar where support is offered to adults with multiple and complex needs and to their carers. 

Our weekly activities are as follows:
 
Mondays: Tots and Tinies (term time) 9.30 - 11.30 am
Tuesdays: Scrabble 2.00pm (2nd & 4th Tuesdays)
Wednesdays: 9.45 am a short time of worship.
Wednesdays: 10.00 am Coffee Morning
Wednesdays: (3rd Wednesday) Lunch 12.30 - to be pre booked on 01284 762459
Fridays: Carpet Bowls 7 pm
 
Further information can be found on our website here.
 
Areas of our premises are also available for hire. Our halls are available to be let for one-off events or regular meetings; details available on our website.
 
We also have seven offices on site which are available to rent. Details and availability of these can be obtained from Shires/Marshall Buck and Casson.

Title: Utilitywise
Body: Established in 1975, Utilitywise has built a reputation as a leading consultancy supporting major energy users within the UK. Acquired by Utilitywise in 2013, the company has gone from strength to strength and now supports over 700 clients delivering innovative solutions to meet their evolving requirements.

Title: Valley Connection
Body:
Valley Connection is one of Bury St Edmunds largest and smartest Indian restaurants.
It was renovated to the tune of �0.5 Million in 2007 and can accommodate up to 110 diners in sumptuous and contemporary surroundings. Elegant carpets and luxurious brown leather chairs set the tone for an up market dining experience with menus that focus on Indian continental dishes to Bangladeshi cuisine. 

You will not see presentation skills of this standard in any other Indian restaurant in East Anglia. Choose from the a la carte and various banquet choices, which are complemented by an extensive new, wine list, which offers a large champagne selection and a connoisseurs section.

If you are planning a special party or wedding event why not let Valley Connections provide all your catering needs? Please view their menu and wine list online and contact them for all booking enquiries.

Title: Vanilla Hair Design
Body: Priding itself on giving the best customer service in and around Bury St Edmunds, you can be sure that Vanilla Hair Design will give you the VIP treatment when you're looking to chop those locks. Also offering beauty treatments such as facials, manicures, waxing and tinting, the salon's mission to it nurture and relax you. Using Aveda beauty treatments and hair colours, this brand has a similar ethos to Vanilla, caring for the world and giving back to society.
Location: 23 Church Street, Bury St Edmunds Suffolk

Title: Vision Express
Body: Built on a passion for the optical profession and a drive for unparalleled customer service, Vision Express opened the first 'one hour' opticians in 1988 and they remain the pioneer of a genuine one-hour service today. They work hard to totally satisfy their customer, stocking glasses, contact lenses, sunglasses, and do children?s eye tests.

Title: Vivs Patisserie
Body: Sandwich, snack and cake shop offering freshly made foods and a selection of breads.

Title: Vodafone
Body: Vodafone Group Plc is the world's largest mobile telecommunications company measured by revenues and the world's second largest measured by subscribers. Visit Vodafone for the latest mobile phones and discover more on mobile internet, mobile broadband, mobile email, music and much more.

Title: Voujon
Body: Voujon takes the very best of Indian cooking and mixes it with the contemporary style of today's modern restaurant. We have a vast knowledge of Indian cuisine and cooking styles to create the most mouth watering dishes to tempt any palette. At Voujon we use only the finest fresh ingredients in our cooking, we believe this enhances the dish to give that delicious distinctive taste.
Location: 29 Mustow Street, Bury St Edmunds, Suffolk, IP33 1XL

Title: Wagamama
Body:
Fresh, fast and fun, Wagamama?s restaurants are modelled on the ramen bars which have been popular in Japan for many years. The Pan-Asian menu consists of side dishes, main meals, desserts and fantastic fresh juices, all cooked fresh to order. As soon as it?s ready, it?s your chance to start - no waiting for the others, in its informal, yet fun and exciting atmosphere. 
 
First launching in 1992, when the first restaurant opened in London?s Bloomsbury, this traditional Japanese experience comes to Bury St Edmunds? popular arc shopping centre, bringing with it a fresh and friendly alternative to dining which has proven such a success over 17 countries so far!
 
Offering a full range of dishes, both seasonal and inspired by the local chefs, you can also enjoy a full take-out service to keep the entire family happy.
Location: arc shopping centre, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Waitrose
Body:
Waitrose aims to combine the convenience of a supermarket with the expertise and service of a specialist shop. They also offer a Price Commitment to ensure you always get good value for money when shopping at Waitrose.

Waitrose in Bury St Edmunds has a passion for stocking local products. A product is defined as 'local' if it is made within a 30-mile radius of the Waitrose branch where it is sold. Local products include sausages, bacon, ice cream, wines and cheese - all made largely from locally produced ingredients, free from unnecessary additives and are usually delivered straight to the branch by the supplier.
 
The Bury St Edmunds store has a caf� and is one of only 32 stores across the UK with a sushi bar. At the bar you?ll find a beautiful range of fresh, innovative, Japanese-inspired fusion food that is handmade and crafted to perfection by the highly skilled chefs. Throughout the day you can watch Sushi Artisans at work, producing the freshest quality sushi for you to enjoy. There?s plenty to choose from, including vegetarian and no raw fish options as well as a variety of platters made to order.
 
Waitrose Bury St Edmunds offers free parking for up to 2 hours if �10 is spent in the store.
 
All My Waitrose Card Holders can get a free tea or coffee and a free paper, if �10 is spent in store.
Location: 2 Robert Boby Way, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Warhammer
Body: The Games Workshop has opened a games store featuring Citadel Miniatures, Warhammer, Warhammer 40,000 and Age of Sigmar.

Title: Waterstones
Body:
Waterstones is the UK's leading bookseller, with millions of books covering every subject. Waterstones' mission is to be the leading bookseller on the high street and online providing customers the widest choice, great value and expert advice from a team passionate about bookselling. Waterstones aims to interest and excite its customers and continually inspire people to read and engage in books.
 
The Waterstones Book Club meets either on the third Wednesday or Thursday of every month, starting at 7pm & finishing around 8.30pm. If you would like to know more and to attend, email the store here or call 01284 750877 and speak to a Bookseller.

Title: Waterstones
Body: Waterstones is the UK's leading bookseller, with millions of books covering every subject. Waterstones' mission is to be the leading bookseller on the high street and online providing customers the widest choice, great value and expert advice from a team passionate about bookselling. Waterstones aims to interest and excite its customers and continually inspire people to read and engage in books.

Title: West Stow Anglo-Saxon Village & Country Park
Body:
One of England?s great archaeological sites, West Stow has extensive indoor galleries and a stunning recreation of an Anglo-Saxon village surrounded by unspoilt countryside. West Stow Country Park features 125 acres of woods, heathlands, a river and a lake, plus nature trails, walks and an adventure playground. 

Visitors to West Stow can explore history and nature, watch a film, dress up as an Anglo-Saxon or say hello to the rare breed pigs and chickens. As part of the annual RingQuest event, you could even meet a Hobbit, among other Lord of the Rings characters!

West Stow regularly hold living history and event days, workshops, walks and talks, these sites and their events bring history to life.

Title: West Suffolk College
Body:
West Suffolk College is an ambitious vocational and academic College, with a stunning main campus set in the heart of Bury St Edmunds. 

We are committed to providing outstanding education to all our students. Our ethos is to put our learners? success at the heart of everything we do. That means we will do everything we can to help our students succeed and be the best they can be. 

We have a wonderful range of courses, facilities, tutors and opportunities to build an excellent foundation for a career or go onto Higher Education. 

As a partner College of the University of Suffolk, we offer more than 40 foundation and honours degrees at the College across a wide range of subjects. 

We have forged valuable links with business and industries across all fields to make sure students develop skills that will increase their employability. 

We believe in engaging with our students as young adults in a supportive and encouraging environment and we aim to give the best opportunity to develop, grow and become passionately involved in their own education. 

Plans to build a world-class sixth form college in Bury St Edmunds have been given the go ahead. 

The college is a collaboration between the West Suffolk College sponsored Suffolk Academies Trust - which includes Suffolk One in Ipswich and local upper schools including King Edward VI School and Sybil Andrews Academy in Bury St Edmunds. 

The college aims to replicate the success of Suffolk One, an outstanding sixth form college, and will offer more than 40 A-Level courses to 16-19 year olds from across the whole of West Suffolk. Curriculums will be timetabled to allow students to study high level specialist vocational qualifications at West Suffolk College alongside their A Levels if appropriate. 

West Suffolk College is on a journey. We have huge ambitions to be the best college in the UK and we believe our community deserves nothing less. 

Success Rates 
84.2% success rate for all ages on long and short qualifications 
86% success rate for 16-18 long qualifications 
80.8% success rate for 19+ long qualifications 
78% success rate for Full Apprenticeship Framework 
88.7% success rate for Full NVQ2 and 3 delivered in the workplace 
87.7% success rate for Higher Education students 
We are a large local employer with 331 full-time staff and a turnover of �26 million.
Location: West Suffolk College, Out Risbygate, Bury St Edmunds IP33 3RL

Title: White Stuff
Body:
As a casual fashion and lifestyle brand for men and women, White Stuff stocks cosy and stylish clothing, accessories, gifts, things for the home and much more. Proud to be different, White Stuff is renowned for its unique colour and prints, as well as its attention to detail.
 
Believing in making a difference and making the world a little happier, White Stuff is a keen supporter of charities through The White Stuff Foundation. Each of their stores throughout the country support a charity that is local to them. Bury St Edmunds White Stuff has chosen to support West Suffolk Charity Gatehouse.

Title: WHSmith
Body:
With over 550 stores on the high street and 490 stores at airports, train stations, hospitals and motorway services, WHSmith is one of the UK's leading retail groups and a household name.

You probably know them best for books, newspapers and stationery. Now, thanks to their carefully chosen partners, they offer an increasingly wide choice of goods through their stores and website - from personalised children's books to personalised greeting cards and magazine subscriptions. In 2010 The Gadget Shop joined WHSmith to add gadgets and gizmos to their offerings.
 
The Post Office now provide their services in the town centre via the first floor of WHSmith. There is a lift available to the first floor.

Title: Wigram & Ware
Body: Wigram & Ware is an opticians offering eye tests, glasses and contact lenses.

Title: Wilcrofts
Body:
Wilcrofts is a well-known caf� in Bury St Edmunds; known for its home cooked food. Offering a range of jacket potatoes, freshly made sandwiches and full English breakfasts alongside full meals such as Lasagne, Fish and Chips, Roasts and freshly made meat pies. Wilcrofts also have a take out sandwich and jacket potato counter. 

Wilcrofts located in Brentgovel Street, has not only been listed in the top ten places to eat in Bury St Edmunds, but has received a maximum five stars in a food hygiene inspection.

Title: Wilko
Body:
In their 80 years of trading Wilko's have embraced changes and challenges in providing you with low prices and convenience, whilst still remaining family-owned.

Today Wilko's have over 350 stores and more than four million of you visit them every week.

Title: Willett & Co
Body:
Willett & Co. solicitors based in the rural town of Bury St. Edmunds was established nearly forty years ago by Clive Willett, the present Senior Partner. Over that period of time the firm has expanded both in size and reputation.
 
They combine traditional law firm values of commitment reliability and expertise with a modern and progressive approach to the delivery of legal services. They are accessible, approachable, they use plain English and they are committed to employing quality staff with the skills to understand the requirements of clients and to deliver exceptional service.
 
Their aim is to provide affordable legal services for all their clients.
 
They know and understand how important it is to keep up with the ever changing world of law. Their website supplies you with the latest legal news by clicking on the ?library? on the menu.
 
They serve the needs of small to medium sized businesses (companies, partnerships and sole traders), families and individuals. They deliver a full range of legal services including:
Agriculture
Banking and Finance
Business and Commercial Advice
Business Contracts
Business Leases
Business related Crime
Childcare
Commercial Litigation
Commercial Property
Corporate Finance
Crime
Debt Recovery
Employment
General Litigation
Landlord & Tenant
Lifetime Planning
Leases
Matrimonial and Family
Personal Injury
Probate and Administration of Estates
Property and Conveyancing
Wills, Trusts, Tax and Estate Planning
At Willett & Co. they use the latest technology to allow them to improve even further the service the firm can give clients both large and small.

Whether you are intending to buy, sell or lease a property, planning for the future with a Will, trust or estate planning, seeking advice on business issues, having financial difficulties, dealing with family issues or facing criminal proceedings, they offer a full range of services advising private individuals and companies.

The Legal Services Commission have awarded the firm Quality Marks for the provision of legal services in criminal law and family law.

They are members of the ?Lawyers for your Business? network and can offer specialist advice to small and medium sized businesses.

Title: William H Brown
Body: William H Brown is a well-established estate agent in the historic town centre of Bury St Edmunds. With an experienced and highly motivated team there are a number of ways in which they could be of service to you; from providing free market appraisals on your property for both sales and lettings, advertising your property, finding you a secure buyer or trustworthy tenant, arranging your mortgage for your onward purchase using their award winning services, re-mortgaging on your existing property or helping you build your portfolio of buy to let investments as a novice or experienced landlord, surveying that dream purchase for you or offering an excellent in house conveyancing service. Whatever your property need William H Brown can help.

Title: William Hill
Body: William Hill is synonymous with delivering a high-quality gaming and betting experience, whether online, in their shops, on the phone, or one the move. Their aim is to give their customers what they want, when they want it, where they want it. Well-known for their 75-year sports-betting heritage, they also offer a full range of gaming products. They are continuously evolving their product range to meet the changing demands of a wide and diverse customer base looking for an exciting and entertaining gambling experience.

Title: Wolf in Sheeps Clothing
Body:
Wolf in Sheep's Clothing (WISC) design ladies, men's and children's tailored button shirts that combine the best fabrics from around the world with impeccable tailoring and effortless style. 

From 2013 collection all our collections are now made exclusively in Great Britain and can be purchased through our website as well as a number of selected premium independent boutiques across Britain. We also attend a number of local and national country shows during the summer and winter months.
Location: 7 St Johns Street, Bury St Edmunds

Title: Work Fit
Body:
Established in 2002, WorkFit have built a reputation as being a flexible, cost effective provider, delivering outstanding services to customers in many sectors such as Food Industry (production and retail), Local Government, Research, Utilities, Engineering, Higher Education and others. 

Our OHAs, qualified to degree or diploma level, are supported by screening nurses and OH administrators. Our Consultant Occupational Physician Dr Chris Sharp leads our team, including our Occupational Physicians. 

Best of all our fees will not change once we've agreed a scope of service. We are local, transparent and here to support you. For a fair and clear guide to Occupational Health call us on 01284 330212.
Location: 5 St. Andrew�s Street North, Bury St. Edmunds

Title: Zen Noodle Bar
Body:
Zen Noodle Bar offers a contemporary oriental dining experience. 
They are a haven of stylish yet informal eating with a menu consisting of side dishes and main dishes of noodle or rice, these include Chinese, Japanese, Thai, Malaysian & Vietnamese influences.
Upon your order, your meal is cooked immediately for ultimate freshness using the best ingredients and is served from their open plan kitchen. Whether you are enjoying a relaxed meal or a quick bite, they provide a friendly & efficient service from their experienced staff who are always on hand to help. They are open 6 days a week for lunch & dinner for Eat-in and Takeaway. Watch out for their weekly ?not to be missed? specials. They also cater for large private parties with an option for set dinners if you are celebrating in style.

Title: Zenith
Body:
At Zenith Staybrite, they manufacture over 200,000 windows and doors for over 30,000 customers every year - that's around 100 customers every working day. Since it was first established, Zenith Staybrite has gone from strength to strength through their commitment to customer service, technical excellence and product innovation.  They're totally committed to looking after their customers and providing excellence in home improvement in every aspect of their business.

Every year, thousands of home owners choose Zenith Staybrite to bring their dream home improvements to reality - successfully and affordably. What's more, 97% of them tell them that they would gladly recommend them, which is an unparalleled customer satisfaction rating.
